productDescription: - The Secura Hot Air Fryer uses hot air in combination with high-speed air circulation (rapid hot air) and a top grill to prepare a variety of tasty dishes in a healthy, fast and easy way
-Use less grease in your cooking with the “Hot Air Cooking” method
-60 minute cooking timer with auto-shut off when your food is done. Heating & Power indicator lights. Variable temperature control 180°~390°F, giving you total control over the food you are cooking
-Added accessories for extra versatility; Toaster rack & skewers
-Accessories included with the Secura hot air fryer for Extra versatility
-2-Year Manufacturer’s Limited Warranty, 120V/1500W extra large 4.0 liter capacity

Fry your favorite foods with hardly any oil! The Secura Hot Air Fryer cuts out the oil to give you crispy food without the added fat. The air fryer uses hot air in combination with high-speed air circulation (rapid hot air) and a top grill to surround food with heated air to cook all of your favorite fried foods quickly and evenly. The variable temperature control ranges from 180-390 degrees (F) and the 60-minute timer automatically shuts off the machine once cooking is complete. The frying basket has an extra large 4.0 liter capacity, making it easy to fry up snacks or a main dish for the whole family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in 3 months...***Please read the Surprised Update***
reviews.reviewText:
The fan stopped working, I only used it 1-2 times a week, small amounts for one. It has only been 3 months. Very sad.

This is a surprised update...
Just got an E-mail from the seller, and they are sending me a replacement...A REPLACEMENT!! This seller is the best, I loved my Air Fryer and I do not blame them for a rare failure, parts do fail, but the speed and care that the are showing a customer is amazing. I recommend them to everyone, this is just amazing, I wrote this review yesterday and they responded in less than 18 hrs. If only all Sellers cared this much. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you, and again Thank you.

First off, I love cooking with the air fryer and this isn’t a bad unit but I guess I got a bit of a lemon. Have had the unit since 4/28/18 so it hasn’t quite been 2 months. One of the screws on the basket holder has rusted. More bothersome is that the handle no longer locks in place making this a safety hazard which is why I gave it one star. The unit has been used a total of about 10 times so I really am bummed. I went with the good ratings this unit had... having said that, it does work well but is no longer any good to me.

PRODUCT UPDATE
I have changed my one star review to 4 stars for the following reasons. First off, when I left the original review my return window had closed by almost a month so I figured all was lost. What I should have done was to have contacted the seller. I never had a complaint about the performance of the air fryer as it worked and still does work perfectly. It was in the handle and basket that I had an issue as stated above. So I placed my one star review based on the fact that the product had become hazardous. In about a day, I heard from the seller to verify my address so that they could send me replacements for what was defective. I did in fact verify it and did receive brand new parts and now the fryer is as good as new! Excellent customer service even when I wasn’t looking for it! It’s nice to know there is still good customer service out there! Thank you!

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not over fill, do shake contents while cooking, use as much as possible
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this thing. My girlfriend first saw the philips brand one onlin and we began looking into them. Turns out most air dryers have a very small capacity for food but this puppy is cheaper and had a 4liter area to fry food. I bought one for her for Christmas and we have used it every single day to air fry meats, vegetables, frozen foods and even air fry cookie dough! They tell you to shake the cooker rack ever 5 minutes to ensure your food frys evenly and this is important. Shake every few minutes because just like a microwave, food cooks faster on the outside than the inside. The moral of the story here is do not over fill the container. We got so excited one night and sliced up as many sweet potatoes as we could fit into the air fryer and it took about twice as long to cook them to crispy perfection as it did with half the amount of potatoes in the container. I have been extremely satisfied that I purchased it and love the air fryer mostly because all of my meat I no longer grill but instead I air fry it. Meat cooked in here stays juicy and the out side cooks to a perfect golden crispy color!

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW! - I even cooked a 5lb turkey in this thing!
reviews.reviewText: Never heard about air fryers until recently. Did my research and decided upon the Secura 1500. First time using it I was a little skeptical and not sure what I was doing. So, I first tried something easy. Sweet potato fries, how hard could that be. Well, not only was it easy to do, but the results were beyond my expectations. Truly did last and feel like deep fried potatoes. Then I went on to bigger and better. Did a Cornish hen. Never cooked one in my life, so again I wasn't sure. Followed the instructions in a recipe book I purchased and success, again! Then I said, OK lets try a pizza. Within 10 minutes prep and 12 minutes cooking I had a great pizza for two. It was so good I tried it again 2 more times using different toppings. I'm hooked. So then I figured lets break the winning streak with an experiment. I purchased a 5lb. frozen turkey breast. I let it thaw, brushed some lite oil mixed with spices on the bird and placed it in the basket. The only problem was the bird was a little too fat and wouldn't let me close the basket without cutting about an inch off the breast. Once I did that, away she went and about 55 minutes later I had the most delicious, tender and moist turkey dinner. This bird was enough for 4+ adults. Overall I find this style of cooking the easiest and cleanup is a breeze. Most dinner portions are good for 2 - 4 people depending on what you're making. Oh, did I tell you how much I love this thing? Best appliance I purchased. Well, add that to the Secura milk frother - love that one too, for my after dinner lattes.

reviews.reviewTitle: DON'T BE FOOLED - This Is a Competent Machine !!!
reviews.reviewText:
I'd like to address the negative reviews. After all, the positive reviews offer a wealth of positive information and are accurate. First of all, the unit is high grade construction as the interior has a full metal lining which acts as a heat shield. There is no burning or melting of any plastic, nor is there a plastic smell with use. Secondly, the controls are simple, well designed, easy to read and work like a charm. They should prove to be more reliable than digital controls and definitely faster to program. Next, the non-stick coatings simply do not chip or flake and appear to be the best quality. Furthermore, as noted repeatedly, the unit is incredibly easy to clean by hand. As far as noise, the machine is quiet with just a subtle fan sound so noise is not even close to being an issue. Lastly, the unit does brown on top and does cook the inside. In fact when I got this terrific beast (1500 Watts), I only had a London Broil to try it out. Can you imagine testing an air-fryer with a big hunk of meat that is best cooked in an oven on broil or grilled.. To my surprise this baby air -fried it to perfection. It was charred on the outside and juicy medium on the inside. Amazing since it was about an inch and one half thick and took 1/2 the time, just 18 minutes. My advice would be to disregard some of the ridiculous reviews that have proved nonsense as far as my experience. In summary, the 4.6 excellent rating is justified here. This is a very generous capacity powerhouse with too many positives to ignore at this price point.

UPDATE..... Found this independent review Below.

Frying Quality
Ease of Cleaning
Warranty
Fryers that made crisp, evenly-cooked food scored highest. Higher is Better.
6 SECURA 93.0 %
1 NUWAVE BRIO 93.0 %
2 BELLA 80.0 %
3 PHILIPS 98.0 %
CATEGORY AVERAGE 85.22 %

The Secura Hot Air Fryer was a decent contender in our testing. It tied for the second-best score on our food frying tests and was one of the best at cooking evenly, though it did have darker and lighter spots in some batches. As with any air fryer, you can prevent uneven cooking by shaking the basket to rotate the food, but the Secura did a decent job even when we didn’t shake the basket, and that's impressive.
The Secura will shut itself down after a cooking cycle. It also has non-skid feet and stays cool to the touch so it scores high for safety. It is a good fit for those who have kids in their household. This is also a good fit for families because of its large capacity. The basket is huge, fitting almost twice as much food as some of the smaller competitors.

The two-year warranty on this one is nice. That is double what most of our tested products have. This air fryer doesn’t have instructional videos, though these products are not all that hard to use.

Most of the fryers we reviewed were louder than we expected, but this was one of the quieter ones. All but two of them were louder than this one. The Secura also gets a perfect score for cleaning. The non-stick basket was easy to clean in the sink, in seconds. It can also go in the dishwasher if you want to save even more time

Summary
The Secura Hot Air Fryer has all of the important safety features and offers easy cleaning and quiet operation. It churned out some really good food. Its large capacity, and associated bulky design, is bad for cramped quarters but
good for feeding a crowd, which makes it a great option for large families.

I did days of research even went to consumer reports on line.. we first bought one at walmart that consumer reports had recommended but when we got home and opened it up it was not sturdy and was cheaply made . I searched amazon throughly and found this one. it is well made and much better than the faberware one we first purchased I would recommend this one, we paid slightly more but the quality is much better, by the way there are 2 in this family but over the memorial holidays there were 6 of us and my husband made fried zuchinne squash for snacks. delicious ! also note the pan is square and can get more food in than the round

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to cook low fat!
reviews.reviewText: Just arrived today and I have already used twice today. I am trying to transition to a low fat, whole foods plant based diet and was getting bored with the "texture" of my food. I was missing the crispiness of cooking in butter or oil. Plus the entire family has loved everything I've made. I wondered prior to purchasing if I would HAVE to use oil. Glad to find out just a smidge of oil has worked. I made french fries for lunch - but did not peel or soak the potatoes as directed. Note I did use small potatoes of all different colors, even purple. The potatoes went so fast with the kids I had to make another batch. For dinner I did green beans. I washed the green beans used a smidge of oil, like 1/2 teaspoon or less tossed with red pepper flakes, bread crumbs and nutritional yeast. Was amazing! I can't wait to continue experimenting. And CLEAN UP is a breeze.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful, Easy To Use Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: Very nice and easy to use. My teens prefer to cook using the air fryer instead of the oven. The little book that provides guidelines for cooking time and temperature were a nice touch. The images on the front of the air fryer provide temperature information but the book provides guidelines on length of time to cook the food. It even provides suggestions on when to add a little oil to what you are cooking. Having the air fryer has made life easier. No messy oil cleanup and no lingering fried oil smell in the house which I used to hate. Everything turns out crisp and delicious. This was definitely well worth the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: New Appliance For Healthy Cooking A Big Success!
reviews.reviewText: My daughter raved about her Air Fryer. I used it when I took care of my two grandsons and I decided to buy one of my own. After reviewing a number of brands I decided on the Extra Large Capacity Secura. It was the fact I could make Kabobs in it that sold me. The Kabobs have been simple and easy to make. I am still experimenting with other things, but I have made a great decision to purchase this new appliance. Healthy eating is a big concern in our family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great when it works....died after 4 monts, waiting to see if mfg/seller will come thru
reviews.reviewText:
I'm not really sure how I should write up this review. I purchased this end of April and have used it about once a week or less since then (due to summer vacations, etc.) I love that it comes with accessories and that it wipes clean so easily. I was worried about other brands that were showing rust and didn't want that problem. I have absolutely loved using my air fryer.
And then...it just quit working. That means it has a shelf life of four months??!! I have sent a message to the seller with no response yet and just contacted the manufacturer. Hopefully someone will make this right. When the product works, it's awesome. As far as durability and/or mfg/seller service....I'll update.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works Well with Easy to Clean fryer drainage basket
reviews.reviewText: I have gone thru 2 other brand's air fryers in 2 years prior to buying this one. The 1st, a premium Phillips model, had a fry basket/drainage tray made of wire that was very hard to clean chicken skin off of. The 2nd brand was easier to clean but the nonstick coating wore off the basket way too quickly. This one has better drainage holes and seems well made. I air fry the best chicken wings with no oil, the best french fries just like McDonalds with no oil, the best rib eye steak with no oil, the best bacon which comes out drained already in the fryer basket. A healthy to get fried food taste and texture, and fast and easy to clean, too!

reviews.reviewTitle: A buy you will not regret !
reviews.reviewText: Unbelievably good buy. I am very,very pleased with it. After I acquired it, I no longer use my Kitchen Aid oven. Even reheating pizzas or bread is great in this device. I am beyond happy. The price is absolutely unbeatable,and the quality is a great match to it as well. It fries large and small cut potatoes, whole potatoes, chicken comes out very juicy. Just wipe clean and start using again. I put foil underneath the tray and replace it after each frying session. The bottom stays clean . I can easily fry 2 large quarters of the chicken or 6 large whole potatoes at once.

reviews.reviewTitle: so their instructions were useless. I returned it to Amazon
reviews.reviewText: I arrived without the skewers. The basket would not release. I called Customer Service. They asked me all sorts of questions regarding the order number, details of my purchase, etc. Then she told me that there was no one to actually speak to me, and that I would receive a response by email only in 1-2 days. I received an email without comment about the missing part, and instructions on how to release the basket. But the basket was not working, so their instructions were useless. I returned it to Amazon. I would not suggest purchasing this air fryer, because they do not have any American based customer or technical support.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cajun chicken and chicken veggie skewers yay !
reviews.reviewText: Very convenient, my kids love french fries. Now we make them ourselves at home. Healthier option. Thanks Secura. Highly recommend.

I wanted, SO BADLY, to love this unit... but I just couldn't.
What it does do: reheats fried food very well and toasts/bakes stuff quickly.
What it doesn't do: fry.
Imagine my surprise when my attempts at fried food came out like they had been baked in the oven when I was expecting the promise of "fried" chicken.
Also, the intial cooking I did in this air fryer left a terrible plasticky taste on my food and a melted plastic odor in the air. I did thoroughly wash all components before use, so I'm assuming part of the initial process involves cooking off the odor/flavor before use. Not sure.
I would liken this air fryer to a countertop sized oven.. or an oddly shaped toaster oven. It just did not live up to my expectations. If you're desperate for crispy-ish chicken without the calories of fried food or a desire to preheat an oven, this is a good option. I, personally, just couldn't justify having a $90 food reheater because I certainly was not going to use it for "frying" anymore.

It took three tries but I finally prepared some French fries that were close to right. My wife prepares excellent fried okra using a regular skillet, something I can't do. However, with this air fryer I've come close and clean up is a lot easier. My only complaint is when you want to dump the basket, you have to contend with the drawer it is in. You can't just leave the drawer in the air fryer, it comes out with the basket so you have to leave it attached when you dump the basket or find someplace to leave it (outside the fryer) while you dump the basket. Leaving it attached when you dump the basket makes it kind of heavy and awkward..

Being a hard core deep fat fryer addict, I didn't think I'd like the air fryer but I was wrong. Now if I could just figure out how to fry a Twinkie in it.

reviews.reviewTitle: don't buy, doesn't last a year
reviews.reviewText: after a year with little use it just stopped working, very unhappy with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is easy to use and clean but I went to warm ...
reviews.reviewText: I got this air fryer 10 months ago and used it fairly often. It is easy to use and clean but I went to warm something up in it last week and it has quit working. It says it has a two year warranty but I am not sure how to return it. I will definitely get another air fryer just don't think it will be this one!

I like that this unit is simple, decent size, no digital or touch screen. I have used it several time and so far so good cooking will be a learning curve and amazon offers a free kindle air fryer book that helps too
Love how easy it is to use and clean afterwards. Fries are amazing. Mozzarella sticks needed to be at a higher temp. Baked cinnamon rolls too

I wanted to like it. When I unboxed this air fryer, I was surprised how this air fryer is basically an cookware with an ancient technology. But somehow I like simple stuff like analog so ok, let’s see how it works. Learned at the first try that I should treat this thing really careful otherwise I would make the non-stick coated basket completely chipped literally in few days. I saw (never had one) several air fryers but all look very cheaply made. So, this part is not for this specific brand. Fine.
Then I saw orange color corroted screws on the basket. Did I do it in a couple of days? Not sure. But this was the real deal breaker.
I liked how it cooked, but I want to buy something solid, at least for a while. Also, timer/temperature dials are not accurate - move around 20-40 degrees. I really wanted to like it. It is going back.

reviews.reviewTitle: it can’t be a new fryer. The surface is ...
reviews.reviewText:
it can’t be a new fryer. The surface is already chipped and the knob clip is loose. The basket frame does not look even. There is a paper board under the fryer basket that is screwed by 3 nails. The basket is also covered with the vinyl from the bottom. I had to reomove the vinyl and the wrapping after taking out the 3 screws. If I cook with this fryer, I will consume all the melted plastic in it.
I decided to return after doing this because I cannot trust this item at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: No oil but all flavor - Easy cleanup
reviews.reviewText:
This thing is amazing! Easy to clean. I have made chicken, French fries, steak, burgers and it comes amazing...sans the fat and very crispy. But if you feel is too crispy you can brush food with a little bit of coconut oil and it comes out more moist. (even though the machine recommends not put oil). And the best part is the fact that the house does not smell of fry food and the kitchen is not yucky greasy!

Definitely follow the instruction for time and temperature... Don't be like my husband that thought it needed more time and burned the bacon. (Ah yes, this is great for bacon... this cooks on its own, while you make eggs and pancakes and voila breakfast is served!).

reviews.reviewTitle: worked great for 3 months it died, then they ignored me
reviews.reviewText:
I got this air fryer 3 months ago and it worked great! I was using it several times a week and definitely loved how little oil I had to use to fry foods. Then one day, it just stopped turning on. I contacted Lafraise and they initially responded very quickly telling me that they would replace it, they wanted me to cut off the plug and send them a picture as well as my shipping address. I responded to their request, and have emailed them daily for the past 4 days and no response. Poor customer service! Buyer beware

UPDATED - went another route to contact them and finally they sent it to me, all in all, it took almost 2 weeks to get another machine

Very pleased. Read a lot of reviews on a lot of Air Fryers before selecting this one. Main points for me where: compact footprint, square basket (fits more than a round one would), knobs rather than digital controls and overall reviews. Have had this for about a month now and use frequently. Perfect size for two people. Extremely easy to use. I cut parchment squares to put in the bottom of the unit (under the pan) to help catch any drips, but honestly this thing requires so little oil that there are little to no drips during cooking. One thing I wasn't thinking we'd use it for is rolls/biscuits. When cooking a "stove top" dinner I'd always forget to turn the oven on to preheat if we wanted rolls or biscuits. By the time I thought of doing so it was too late to get it preheated and rolls done. With this air fryer I set the temp on 360, put four rolls or biscuits in the pan (this is where that square shape comes in handy as there's plenty of room) set the timer at five to six minutes and hot rolls are done! Also great from low oil fries. We have tried bag fries and Sea Pack shrimp but ultimately we purchased to cook healthier alternatives so our home made fries (regular or sweet potato) are great! We are very satisfied with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing works great. It saves time cooking
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my wife for Christmas, wasn't sure if it would be a hit. This thing works great. It saves time cooking. I always used to have to double the package time for things like fries to get them good and crunchy, and still had to include time to pre-heat the oven. The air frier produced crispy fries in without all the hassle. It really did the trick. We have tried Perogies, Veggie Bites, and Mozzarella Sticks, each time they came out wonderfully crunchy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside. I was even able to cook Scrapple, it didn't have the full flavor of scrapple cooked in bacon fat, but it was absolutely no hassle - WAY easier, set it up, walk away. Clean up was a breeze too.

reviews.reviewTitle: New Convert from my Old Conventional Stove/Oven
reviews.reviewText: We've been working toward a healthier lifestyle in our house and one of the things we really wanted was a better way to cook with less oil. After researching many different units before deciding on this one we are certain we made the right choice! The unit itself holds a good amount of food - definitely enough room for 2-3 people. You can probably get 4 cuts of meat in it, but we just haven't had a reason to cook that much at our place. The unit's footprint makes it less of a counter space hog in the kitchen and I like the design of the knobs vs. digital push buttons. We started out with chicken cutlets and they came out perfectly juicy and seasoned. Followed up with pork and also cooked biscuits and a small cake in it. In all cases, the unit cooked beautifully. You will no doubt have to experiment with times, etc., but everything we have done so far has come out well. An added bonus is that the house no longer smells like a deep fryer from cooking on the stove top! Clean up is also a breeze. The basket releases from the tub unit and both are easy to wash and wipe down. Though there is little oil, we suggest putting either aluminum foil or, our preference, parchment paper in the bottom of the unit to make clean up even easier! We just cut several pieces into the correct size and have them on hand when needed. Final thought, we did buy an oil mister for those times when we cook items without a lot of natural oils in them. We haven't had the need to use it yet, but do have several friends with air fryers who believe an oil mister is a must have so you may want to set your kitchen up with that as well. All in all, we are exceptionally happy with this unit an glad we've found a better way to cook in our house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everyone in the family likes it.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this air fryer on line and when it arrived, my husband said,"Oh great. Another appliance!" For lunch that same day I put a handful of frozen tater tots in the bin to try the air fryer out. My husband ate them all. His comment, "These are better than you get at a restaurant." I made him more for dinner. That evening he wanted a lesson in how to operate and clean up the air fryer because I was going to be gone the next day. Someone in our family uses it everyday. Best thing we have bought in quite a while.

reviews.reviewTitle: * Chicken Nuggets * Grilled Cheese Sandwich * A spinach burger * and a some other small things I'd like to point out it's noisy
reviews.reviewText:
I was excited to try my first air fryer and have cooked quite a few things over the past few weeks, including:
* Chicken Nuggets
* Grilled Cheese Sandwich
* A spinach burger
* and a some other small things

I'd like to point out it's noisy. Some have said it's not that noisy and everyone has their own acceptable levels, but to me, this is pretty loud. When it's tucked in the corner of my kitchen, some of the noise gets lost in the walls. When it's in the middle of the kitchen island, it sounds like you're next to an extremely loud fan. Which would be fine if you're leaving the kitchen while it cooks. I like to watch TV from the living room while cooking so it's a little too loud for my liking.

It does make things crispy. Not nearly as well as I was hoping and no where near like a deep fryer would. But crispier than microwaving for sure.

My favorite thing to make so far is a grilled cheese sandwhich. It cooks it perfectly (most of the time). Sometimes when you put the sandwhich in and close the door, the top slice of bread slips off and gets a little burned on top. If it doesn't slip off, it's perfect! Only problem is you can only ever cook one grilled cheese sandwich at a time. It's about the same amount of time as it would be to put one in a pan but the cleanup is much easier.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have used it every day and works fine. I gave it a 3 because of the ...
reviews.reviewText: Have used it every day and works fine. I gave it a 3 because of the ridiculously tiny lettering around the timing dial.. Not only are the numbers tiny, they're not very sharp.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just a little bit oil makes super crispy fried chickenh
reviews.reviewText:
Just got this air fryer today. Easy to use and clean! Just a little bit oil makes super crispy fried chicken. Taste is amazing!!! I will try more recipes. Some people mentioned that their fryer broke after a few months. Hopefully it won’t happen!

Update
I tried more recipes
Crispy noodle was amazing!
Chicken with salt lemon paper turned out incredible. Fried potatoes didn’t come out good but I think that was my fault.

I recommend my friends and some were buying it too

I love this appliance! It is easy to clean and makes the best french fries - perfectly crispy with very little oil (just enough to coat them). I made the Bloomin' Onion (recipe in the enclosed cook book) - it was amazing.
This unit is quiet and easy to clean and use. The large basket holds enough for our dinner (two people) and my husbands lunch to take to work the next day. I would purchase this again. I read all the reviews on all of the larger air fryers and microwave/convection ovens before purchasing this and would make the same decision. I love this unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok overall, but with an extremely annoying design flaw
reviews.reviewText:
Air fryers are basically toaster ovens with enhanced convection mode on all the time. They do work better than regular toast ovens in certain tasks, such as reheating french fries or chicken nuggets.

This fryer is of medium size, and the power level is adequate. The non-stick coating works fine. The elevated wire stand meant to help air circulation is, however, very poorly designed and built. The gaps are way too big to keep fries or nuggets in place. It also comes without coating, and therefore always ends up with food sticking to it. Using it is a constant struggle and source of frustration.

reviews.reviewTitle: I should've Purchased This A Long Time Ago
reviews.reviewText: I should've purchased this a long time ago. When all the hype started around Air Fryers I really didn't get it. I so "Get It" now! It is literally one of my favorite kitchen appliances. I live in a relatively warm environment and the house holds heat in a way that can make you re=think turning on your oven in the summer. This eliminates having to reconsider what you want to eat because you don't want to use the oven. This is quick easy and the clean up job makes it that much more attractive. I can do french fries without oil I can heat up left overs in 5 min. I don't even have to add time to pre-heat. It's literally 5 min from the time you think of it. It's truly one of my favorites purchases this year. If you're thinking about it get it. You won't regret it!

Super fast way of cooking a lot of stuff. I have used this to cook chicken breasts and hamburgers. My dog is older and can only eat a limited number of foods. SO we cook hamburger for her. This will let me cook 10 burgers at a time, using the rack to stand them on their side. In just 10 minutes, I have ten burgers with most of the grease drained into the bottom. Super easy clean up. Just fill with hot water and wipe out.

I got this to cook fries, but have been using it to cook everything else. While we have a regular oven, this is much faster. No preheating.

Also, it's super quiet.

reviews.reviewTitle: I was very pleased. Cooked wings in a tablespoon of oil
reviews.reviewText: Haven't learned everything about how to use it yet, but the few times I have used it, I was very pleased. Cooked wings in a tablespoon of oil. They came out nice & crisp. Also did frozen French fries, they turned out good too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spontaneous electrical meltdown after one year
reviews.reviewText: Suddenly have an electrical meltdown after 1 years light use. Fortunately we were in the kitchen so a fire was prevented.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good purchase after other brand died early
reviews.reviewText: This is a good buy so far. We originally had an as seen on TV model (different brand) that died under a year and couldn't find our proof of purchase. This is a simpler design (no touch buttons or preset cooking modes), and to be honest that is preferred. This thing cooks extremely quick and with the right settings cooks just about anything. Our previous unit also had a round basket, this square design seems much better suited to the job. There really isn't anything I can think of as a negative. Just hoping this brand last longer than my last unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooks wonderfully. Just as good as that very expensive brand.
reviews.reviewText: I love this airfryer. I bought the 4.2 quart. It has a nice square basket size If I had more than one or two in the family I would go for the next size up. To give you an idea of how big the basket is I put in a large bone in chicken breast slightly flattened by cutting the breast bone part way and a pork cutlet. I set for 360 degrees for ten minutes flipping the cutlet half way through. I took the cutlet out flipped the chicken and turned to390 degrees for another 15 minutes.i was shocked how moist and tender both meats were. I have had no problems with chipping or peeling so far. The basket is very easy to clean. Just a little soap and water allowing to set a couple minutes and that’s it.

Love it. Only wish would be an on/off button verses just having to set the timer to 0 to turn off. I'm afraid manipulating the timer to turn off all the time would somehow affect the ability for the timer to go off when needed.

So initial thoughts after the first usage.

The unit as a whole is the size of a large coffee maker and not excessively heavy. The controls are simple and less complicated then a toaster oven.

For the first run I purchased 7 pounds of chicken wings. Divided them up into four servings. So figure about 1.75 pounds. This equated to roughly 25 wings. That I seasoned in a ziplock bag and dumped into the fryer basket. As some reviewers suggested I mixed a few tablespoons of cooking oil into my seasoning and sweet tai chili sauce. I did forget to line the pull out tray with foil. The 25 wings filled the bottom of the basket with only one or two wings making a second layer. (I have the mid size unit). I did remember to shake the wings mid way through the time cycle. The initial directions of 360 degrees for I believe it was 24 minutes after a 4 minute warm up cycle was insufficient. I had to add about 15 minutes including bumping the temp up to 400 degrees for the last five minutes. The results were perfection. Caramelized sauce and moist fully cooked meat.

So do not expect recommended times to be spot on. You will have to experiment. Despite forgetting the foil. Clean up was a breeze because I rinsed it out quickly. I would definitely buy this product again and I am looking forward to experimenting with many dishes.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT WAIT - BUY ONE NOW!
reviews.reviewText: I am not a big, nor great, cook...HOWEVER, this makes EVERYTHING so freaking easy!!! I've cooked jalapenos, steak, burgers, pork chops, French fries, tator tots, bacon wrapped jalapenos, asparagus, etc. It's the easiest thing ever! I was always a big griller...not anymore...the meat tastes just as good as grilling, BUT so much jucier. I really can't say enough good things about this one...OH AND THE SIZE...it really is extra large! All I can say in closing is - GO BUY ONE NOW!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t need more expensive one than this! Don’t go smaller either.
reviews.reviewText:
Highly recommend! This is amazing, everything is coming out perfect. I had debated about buying a philips or more expensive one but no need! The large size is recommended, any smaller and would be hard to make a family serving (4) of fries without doing in multiple batches. So easy to use and clean too.

4 weeks later: seriously life changing! Chicken breasts, fish, meatballs, charred broccoli and cauliflower w olive oil and salt taste better than you’ve ever cooked them! Has made us crave the healthy foods we used to begrudgingly choose over less healthy options. SO worth the investment, has become our weeknight go-to for everything!

We have been using this for two years now. And it is still holding up great. We use it for lunch mainly. My husband wants to get another one for downstairs by our football room. that way he doesn't have to go upstairs and won't miss his football. That's silly to me I think. but you know if he likes it that much to want to get a second one than hey this is working out well for us. we take the pieces apart and we put them into the dishwasher for washing and it's pretty simple it just takes up a lot of room. And I do like using this better than turning on the oven a lot less energy and they're crispier.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved using it til it quit
reviews.reviewText:
This quit working after 7 months of regular use.

I love making shoestring fries with this, also hot dogs, warming up foods (gooey foods wrap in foil). So having a freezer full of fryer-ready foods and a fryer not working is a bummer. I think its the button that depresses inside when the basket is pushed in, that is not working properly, because I noticed early on that the plastic inner basket was wearing out and cracking in that spot and suspect this is the weak link that just quit. It seems the timer is the old fashioned egg timer type as it runs independent of the rest (keeps ticking when basket is pulled out). Both timer must be on and basket pushed all the way in for over to heat but after a couple times where it worked off and on, finally stopped altogether (tried to see if depressing the button kicks it on but it doesn't so maybe there is more contact needed).

There is only enough room in the basket for one decent serving of fries and using the rack to stack them seems to interfere with optimum crispness. This is really just big enough for one person.

I suspect that the max 400 degree setting is actually cooking a tad cooler, maybe 375, but it does ok with foods recommended for 400.

Unless you want foods drying out, preheat first for a minute or two. Oh, and if using foil to cover your food you need to have the food weigh down the foil (wrap completely) or the fan will push the foil up into the overhead burner. I find if the foil is a square, just bend the corners up toward a tip and the foil can be used to lift the food out (it doesn't retain heat).

reviews.reviewTitle: Air Fryers live up to the hype
reviews.reviewText: For anyone thinking about getting an air fryer, do it! I use mine all the time and it really does "fry" chicken with a crispy crust. It is not a time saver necessarily, but it is a nice appliance that doesn't heat up your kitchen like the oven does. My favorite thing to make in it is bacon and my house doesn't end up smelling like bacon for the next week and a half. It is easy to clean since you just toss it in the dishwasher. The dials are a little cheap, especially for the price of the product, and that is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: but I wouldn't recommend this to anyone with any respiratory issues
reviews.reviewText: Im not sure if the item is defective, but I wouldn't recommend this to anyone with any respiratory issues. This product gives off a horribly strong electrical smell. I had to turn on the vent and open a window. Very unpleasant experience. It may just be the item is defective.

I love my Secura AirFryer and use it almost every day!! It is so easy to operate...which is exactly what I wanted. It cooks everything perfectly. ( You will need to experiment with temp and time to get things to your preference) It is particularly impressive on chicken wings and bacon! You can reheat ( frozen) fried chicken or egg rolls and they come out like the day you ordered them. NOTHING has ever been such a game changer for me! It's a breeze to rinse out the basket and tray between uses...but there are no other instructions as to the maintenance of the oven. My only issue is the cleaning of the actual inside of the oven. There is a lot of grease build up and since it is so close to the coils, I am worried about a fire. I have scoured the internet on tips to effectively clean it...but the standard 'soap and water' suggestions do not work. I would like to try standard spray oven cleaner but I am unsure as to whether that will hurt my oven. If anyone has any suggestions, I'd be appreciative of a comment.

After experiencing an air fryer while visiting with family, I decided that it would be a good addition to our kitchen. I did some research and decided that the Secura met our needs and we have not been disappointed. We have cooked fries, chicken strips, broccoli and more. Generally everything came out great, but I would encourage people to start with the lowest time suggested. You can always add a bit more time if needed. I really like the idea of the wire rack on this model, even though we haven't used it yet. The Secure works very well and we are both pleased.

I had never used one of these but others said they were happy with theirs so I tried it. I was pleasantly surprised. It is as fast a frying but much easier. You don't need grease to cook in, and what grease there is in the chicken skin end up in the bottom of the pan, not on your chicken. The chicken consistently tastes good right down to the bone, which has not been true when frying. The moistness is similar to Churches chicken, which I also like, if you have had that. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to cook small amounts of food. I've only done one thigh and two drumsticks so far. It has turned out well every single time.

This is by far a great air fryer! I follow a healthy lifestyle so this appliance is important to me. I have owned to Philips air fryer. They were both very expensive and did not last long. I read the reviews on this air Secura fryer and thought let me give it a try. I love it! It is easier to use, faster, the clean up is quick and easy, everything I have made in this air fryer has a awesome taste and texture. I just bought a second one as a gift. Stop reading the reviews and buy this air fryer, you will be so happy

I love fried food. Let's admit it, most of us do. Adds a lot of flavor and texture. Is it healthy? NOPE. I feel like buying this Air Fryer is a partial solution to that problem. I can cook things like fries without the use of a ton of oil. Perfectly health? NOPE. But getting closer. Food comes out great, especially when reheating things. 5/5, don't know why this genius invention wasn't made earlier, this thing is great.

PROS: Lots of space in it, easy to clean does the job well, have it for a while and still use it ALMOST DAILY, better at reheating food than microwave if you want to keep the texture and not eat soggy or rubbery microwaved food.

CONS: MAKE SURE YOU CLEAN IT OFTEN, that includes the tray, the bucket, and also INSIDE the air fryer. Stuff can get stuck there unexpectedly...

reviews.reviewTitle: A great appliance that is taking the place of several of mine!
reviews.reviewText: I haven't found a dislike yet. Purchased this about a month ago to help out while the kitchen was being remodeled. I needed a small appliance to fill in for my oven. I've done everything BUT French Fries on this appliance. I am amazed at how well food tastes. The outside gets a little crispy but the inside stays moist. It's very easy to use and clean up has been a snap. I spray the inner pan before I cook and that makes clean up with soap and sponge (not the green scrubby one!) so quick. The only thing I wish Secura would have added would be a cookbook. They have a few recipes included, but not enough. However, I've been using the Pinterest recipes for air fryers and that works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price to get you into the Air Fryer community
reviews.reviewText: Great price to get you into the Air Fryer community. I didn't do much research before I purchased this one - but now that I know more about air fryers, I am very satisfied with this. Large, square basket that holds a lot. Easy to wash and use. Comes with a wire "ledge" so you can cook another layer at a time but I feel this slows down the cooking process. Very happy with this purchase and the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: after 10 month, the time dial button do not ...
reviews.reviewText:
after 10 month , the time dial button do not turn off even when it reach the off or cero,
but they offered to change the equipment immediately
5-star to custom service.

This is the only machine that I have found so far that comes with a 2 year warranty. Everything else
is only one year. Well made the only problem I have found it the lettering on the temperature and time knobs. It is so small you cannot read it. I had to take small strips of white tape and stick it on
the machine around the knobs and write down the temperature or time on these strips for reference.
Other than that its pretty good.

Just received my air fryer today!!! I’m completely blown away on how awesome this thing is! I love fried food, but my health conscience always kicks in and limits my habits. I live in LA and in the summer time... it’s UNBEARABLE to cook in an old 1920’s house that has no central AC. This fryer gives off very little to no heat. For me just turning on the stove feels like a 400 degree oven in my house. For my first time use, made chicken wings and they were UBER crispy- felt like I was in a bar for Sunday football chowing down on some hot crispy wings. Now I can enjoy all the fried foods at a fraction of the cost, calories, and fat content :)
Did not brown items as expected.

I have been air frying everything since I bought this. It is awesome and clean up is a breeze. My only complaint are the dials - I wish they were a little more exact. It only shows some numbers with dots in between, so you kind of have to guess the time and temperature. But it is still usable, just would be easier with more exact dials.

We love to cook items that are usually cooked, fried, or otherwise prepared with oil and grease. Since we purchased this fryer, we are preparing everything grease-free. The cooking time is VERY short, and the food always turned out fantastic. Clean up in easy since we can put the basket into the dishwasher. A total winner that helps us to eat healthier and lighter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the Job of a Big Oven
reviews.reviewText:
I do love this air fryer, do not regret the purchase at all, am having fun experimenting.
It is ideal as now I do not have to use my big useless oven anymore and will also save me cleaning it.
I would have given it 5 star, just the little plastic bit on the handle worries me in case it would break.
It seems strong enough though.
And I hope it will last.

Needed a bigger Air Fryer than the one we had. Love the bigger area and being able to cook things like chicken strips and fries together. We haven't used the included rack yet, but might sometime. Cleaning is pretty easy. I had melted cheese in there, soaked with some hot water and soap, and rinsed cleaned. Very happy with this model. I didn't want something with digital keys etc, because that is more to fail. The simple knobs on this work well enough for us. Comes with a book with cooking temps, which is helpful.

After reading many reviews and comparing I chose this one. Does many things well.
French fries from frozen in as little as 7 or 8 minutes without heating up the house!
Makes nice crispy flour tortilla wraps without oil.
Grills hotdogs nicely in about 4 to 5 minutes.
Well worth the money.

I tried my air fryer for the first time making fried chicken. It worked great and tasted great but I could only cook two (rather large) pieces at a time so it did take quite a while to cook all 6 pieces, although each batch only took about 20 minutes. Regardless, I would recommend. It says that all pieces are dishwasher safe but I decided to hand wash just to be safe. I’m excited to try new recipes!

So far, we love this! We are a family of four and have used this for chicken, fish, fries, sweet potato fries, and hot dogs. There's a learning curve, but following the instructions in the manual is helpful! If I could go back in time I would've splurged for the larger model so we wouldn't have to do as many batches when doing meal prep in advance.

I deduct half a star because above the handle there are a series of gaps in the main body of the air fryer, so when you lift out food, any crumbs fall into those gaps and are quite hard to get out without resorting to putting it in the dishwasher, and I prefer to hand wash non-stick items.

This is our first air fryer, but I feel like it was a bargain!

I’m going to tell you what, if you don’t have an air fryer now you better run out and get one. We’ve had one for a while now and I tell you what it never disappoints. And I’m not just saying that we cook everything in this bad boy. These little Porkchop medallions rubbed in this magic seasoning which I love and I use this one on everything pretty much not just chicken, but 15 minutes in the air fryer and you got a really yummy moist tender pork tenderloin. I got a bag of frozen peas in the microwave and a instant pack of instant Idaho red potatoes. So easy and delicious!

reviews.reviewTitle: A good air fryer but not over 100.00
reviews.reviewText: I bought this a few months ago under 70.00 and thought that was the regular price, turns out it's 105.00. At the time I was looking for something durable and affordable. It's great for fried chicken even double battered with very little oil as well as beef and fish. The drawback cleaning the basket but it's big enough to hold a lot of food for its size. For the most part it's worthy of the cost if it were under 100.00

I bought this product in order to try it out before buying one for my son and daughter-in-law who live in Indonesia and don't have an oven. It's great! I live alone and mainly use it to cook salmon, and chicken. Perfect for one or two people, and lots of recipes online for air fryers. The only drawback is that the timer knob is not terribly precise, so I always but on my microwave timer when cooking. Very easy to clean. I never put it in the dishwasher, because I use it so often.

This was ordered to replace the Chefman that stopped working on the 3rd use. I absolutely love this one. The basket is large enough for 3 chicken breasts or a 16 ounce bag of frozen fries. Everything cooks evenly and when I make pork chops they are crislp on the outside and juicy tender on the inside. I find myself even using it for restaurant left overs because it heats things all the way through without drying them our or making them inedible. I highly recommend this one. You'll find you use it much more than you thought you would.

reviews.reviewTitle: Claims to come with recipes, but it's really an ...
reviews.reviewText: Claims to come with recipes, but it's really an instruction manual with just a few recipes. I went out and bought an air fryer recipe book, but now realize this air fryer doesn't have the metal pan accessories that many recipes require. If I had known this I would never had purchased this air fryer!

This is my first time using an air fryer. I am glad I bought a larger unit. Even this size limits how much can be cooked at one time. Cooking is easy & relatively fast. Clean up is extremely easy. Finding good recipes & easy recipes & learning what works & what doesn't is a little tougher. I have used it the last 2 days since I received it. The chicken wings worked great. I made pork chops last night which were just ok.

LOVE this! I was skeptical about buying a big, bulky product that I wouldn’t use and have to store but this has a permanent spot on my counter! EVERYTHING we have cooked in this has been perfect! It’s like having a toaster oven and fryer in one but not all of the unhealthy oil. Chicken, vegetables, anything frozen (fish, mozzarella sticks, potato skins) all come out perfect and quick! This model has a large basket and VERY easy cleanup. I just put the basket in the dishwasher. Definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: It makes the best grilled cheese you have ever had
reviews.reviewText: My co worker told me about her air fryer and convinced me to get one. I don't fry foods but miss that crispness. It arrived a couple days ago and I have tried several items in it. I'm hooked!! It makes the best grilled cheese you have ever had! Did turkey bacon this morning and it was crispy! Chicken/ veg kabobs I did yest were awesome!! This has changed the way I cook!

This was delivered on October 12. We used it very occasionally and lightly to do French fries and to heat up food such as naan break. It stopped working after four weeks. Now I have to go out of my way to send it back for repairs. A total waste of my money and my time.

I'm very surprised by the reviews for this thing. I've had it for a while now, and I have never been able to get anything to cook correctly in this thing. When cooking food, half of it will be burnt and the other half will be totally under cooked. You basically have to stand there and take the food out every minute and move it around. Actually, even that doesn't work.

This works really well so far for everything we've tried. You do have to give yourself some extra time to cook multiple batches when making larger quantities, but you have to do that when frying in a pan as well. The clean-up in this thing is a dream, and I love how you don't need to pre-heat. If you're the kind of person who frequently uses a toaster oven and enjoys fried food, I definitely recommend this air fryer. Also, if you're trying to consume healthy, more expensive fats, such as coconut oil, palm oil, and lard, using the air fryer saves a lot of money since you're not filling a giant pan with expensive coconut oil.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... necessarily the quality of the product but I am disappointed. Everything takes twice as long as the instructions ...
reviews.reviewText: I don't know if it's necessarily the quality of the product but I am disappointed. Everything takes twice as long as the instructions say it should so what is the point? Also the basket is really small so I usually need to do 2 portions which takes twice as long. And finally it would have been really nice if it had come with even a better selection of recipes.

I bought this for Christmas and absolutly love it. We have used it maybe 7 times and each time we are shocked at how well things turn out. It's better than using the oven because it doesn't heat up the entire kitchen. Things also turn out better. French fries are amazing. Taquitos nice and crunchy. Chicken tender and juicy. LOVE how it cooks.

The reason I am giving it 3 stars is because of the build quality. As you can see by the pictures I posted the screws are rusting. These are the screws on the inside of the drawer at the top. There are 4 of them and all 4 are rusting. You're supposed to wash it with a soft sponge and mild soap, so it's going to get wet. Why would you not use screws that won't rust? I haven't contacted customer service yet, but that's coming in the next couple of days.

Depending on the response I get I'll update my review.

We are enjoying having this in our kitchen. We burnt our first batch of French fries, but we learned to not just set the timer and let it do its thing. We set the timer for close to the time we figure it will take, but check the product several times during the cooking process to get it just right. I have made cheese crisps in it. I love my frozen burritos crispy, so I thaw them out a bit in the microwave, spray Pam on both sides, then start it up in the air fryer; so good!

What did we ever so without this air fryer?! It is fast, quiet, and doesn't heat up the kitchen like oil frying. Beyond EASY to clean. So far, I have made perfect chicken tenders from scratch, egg rolls, pot stickers, and some frozen junk food that my hubby wanted to try. Everything turned out golden, crispy, and delicious.....and NOT greasy. I will update this review if anything changes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes great food without the mess
reviews.reviewText: I really really like this product, I actually used it last night making fried catfish. At first I was having a problem getting the skin on fish to have that “crunch” as if you put it in oil and fried it. But after trial and error I now have the same tasting outcome without the hassle of cleaning up oil splatter all over the place. FYI just lightly spray it with an oil and your good to go. For all other food products it works great as well. Makes delicious wings and fries. I did go with the bigger 4.2 qt simply because I like lots of food.

Use this for anything and everything I normally cook in the oven or reheat in the microwave. Makes food crispy! Clean up at first was very easy but seems to get harder everytime for some reason

Update, I ran the basket through the dishwasher and it is junk now. Loved it the first year, but it is not easy cleanup or dishwasher safe as advertised.

Update, still using this but the basket is just gross and won't come clean so we line it with foil. I will definately buy another air fryer but just not this brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than 2 months.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this air fryer for my wife for Christmas. We really enjoyed this item while it worked. Suddenly after only six weeks it stopped working, no heat, no fan, no nothing. Very disappointed.

I am enjoying my secura air fryer. It’s a decent size for 2 people but I may have preferred a larger size. Making this size work for us though. The bucket under the frying basket is a non-stick surface so it has been easy to wipe down for cleaning. I recommend this product.

What an amazing appliance!! I have used this everyday since I received it (3 days ago) 😜 easy to use, easy to clean, and the food turns out amazing!! I made fish in it tonight and it was so good!! Looking forward to a long relationship with my new Air Frier!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Actually comparable to an oil fryer
reviews.reviewText:
This is a great buy. We've used this to cook bacon, French fries, potato wedges from fresh potatoes, taquitos, tortilla chips from fresh tortillas, and chicken wings. All turned out crispy and like they were fried rather than baked, but without the heavy oil taste. It's also great for reheating fried food leftovers. Definitely recommend this if you're looking to try an air fryer.

Update December 2018: We use this fryer every day. It is an essential appliance in our kitchen, and I'm so glad this is the one I bought.

I live alone and use this every day. For a family it would make side-dishes. It doesn't give off much heat so is good for summer cooking. I bought one for my daughter in southern Illinois and it is all she uses in the summer heat. It would be nice if the minutes could be set individually because it is marked in 5 minute increments. Sometimes I just set it for whatever approximate time I want and then set a timer on my microwave.

This is my first air fryer, but so far I like it. Stuff doesn't taste like fried, but then I didn't expect it to. Does make stuff much crispier than the oven. The air fryer works great. I have only used it a half dozen times, but I am satisfied.

Since I purchased this air fryer, I have not used my stove much. It cooks meat and fish, and even cheesecakes. Easy to clean, too.
Also, much faster than a conventional oven. I can cook pork ribs in around 10 minutes.
I had been thinking of buying a new stove, but I think I will spend the $600.00 on something else.
BTW, I am talking about cooking for one or two.

Absolutely LOVE this air fryer! Cooks quickly and fries food without oil! (I do a light spray of olive oil though) Comes with skewers and rack, cleans up spotless as food does not stick and is lightweight. I highly recommend this product!

Have used this a few times now and wonder why I hadn't found it earlier! I tried a couple of easy recipes included in the owners manual and they turned out perfectly. Saved a ton of recipes on Pinterest and ready to try different things. Love that it creates a hot meal w/o heating up my kitchen! I do see some plastic has melted on both corners on the front of my fryer, though, which is a bit disconcerting!

Love this air fryer! Very easy to clean, and air fries food very quickly. Somewhat bulky, and capacity of bin could be larger. (Only five chicken thighs fit in this "extra large capacity" 4,2 Qt air fryer). Despite the relatively small capacity, and bulk, its speed, frying with minimal oil, price, and ease of cleaniing, still makes this a Five Star product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great must have in the kitchen
reviews.reviewText: So far the air fryer is holding up well. I've cooked a number of easy items in this as it was my main purpose of buying. I work from home and it is nice to have a oven that only takes a few minutes to cook your items so you can eat before your break is over. You really have to figure out your cooking times, but other than that I am very happy with my purchase. Looking forward to cooking new items in my fryer.
Great Fries. I followed the recommendation to toss the fresh cut fries in a little olive oil. Came out crispy on the outside and nice and soft in the middle.

This is honestly the best kitchen appliance I have ever bought. My only gripe is that the cooking area is small - I guess that is required for it to work its magic - but the food comes out fantastic! My go to boneless, skinless chicken thighs - it really gives the outside some nice crunch/texture like it was fried in oil, but way easier, and the inside is juicy and delicious. Highly recommended!

I love this air fryer! The basket is a very generous side and is extremely easy to keep clean. I like the sliding cover over the basket release because it keeps me from pressing it absentmindedly. The only thing I would have liked different is more detail on the timer and temperature knobs. Some recipes I’ve tried call for odd cook times or temperatures that I have to “guesstimate” because they aren’t marked or digitally programmable.

My mom talked me into buying an air fryer. I made the right decision in purchasing this one. I've had it for several months now with no trouble. The non-stick has not come off and is a breeze to clean. I've prepared so many foods in it. Fries, roasted squash, cornish hens...just to name a few. I highly recommend purchasing this if you want a fast, compact alternative to using the oven.

My family and I absolutely love this thing. It's so easy to use and make some of our favorite foods even quicker than our counter top Breville convection oven. It's also even safer to use for my pre-teen to make his own snacks/meals. I'd definitely buy again, and if I were giving any advice, I'd just buy a bigger one!
very small Cooking for 1,

As a fitness Competitor I am always looking for ways to make my meals as healthy as possible the air fryer has been fantastic this is the perfect size for those of you with families I have beat everything from chicken thighs french fries potatoes veggies you name it there’s no smell easy cleanup and as a single mom of three it is time efficient… My son even knows how to use this all by himself to make his morning burritos it’s a must kitchen gadget

Nice item works very well and a good size for our family of four. The only outside is that the recommended roomed especially for French fries are a bit of and you may want to monitor closely with your favorite foods to decide time and temp settings you are most comfortable with

This is my second air fryer. My first was from a much better known company and cost over twice as much. I like this product better. It has more room and is quieter. The only problem is that it has a top temp of 390F and many recipes call for a cooking temp of 400F. Of course, it works fine if you adjust the timing. I definitely recommend this fryer.

So far, so good! I love how much easier the basket is to clean vs. the previous AF I owned which didn't even last 2 years with minimal use. The company/seller seems very proactive and wants to make sure each customer is happy with their purchase. That's worth a lot these days!

I love this gadget cooker! I have cooked many things but my favorite is chicken wings. So so easy. I usually cook them from frozen because I tend to forget until I want them, and they are perfect! I love that there is no fat on them and super crispy. I also cook bacon, regular and turkey and it is better then pan cooked. Love this thing!

reviews.reviewTitle: So we love this air fryer
reviews.reviewText: So we love this air fryer. We’ve cooked wings in it twice and they were delicious. We didn’t even add any seasoning other than salt. It is worth the money. We plan to try it for more things, we just haven’t had a chance. A better cookbook to accompany the air fryer would have been nice. That so far, would be my only complaint.
That item arrived without the toast rack and the 4 skewers

reviews.reviewTitle: So far we have used it for chicken tenders and french fries and some pizza snacks and all were so much better tasting than any oven or microwave could have done
reviews.reviewText: My wife wanted an air fryer, among other things, for Christmas so she got this from me. So far we have used it for chicken tenders and french fries and some pizza snacks and all were so much better tasting than any oven or microwave could have done. My wife will be trying some other foods in it and has read the booklet extensively. She initially had a little trouble opening it but now has the knack. This is a very good product.

Best purchase I've made in a while. I was skeptical about buying this and still having good quality tasting food come out of this. I have not been disappointed about anything I've made. Steak, burgers, potatoes, even a cake. I wish I'd bought this sooner. I'm in love. And clean up is so easy. I ordered this on a Friday night and it was on my porch Sunday morning. Fast shipping is always a plus. Now I know what to buy for family members when it's time to buy gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very happy except for the Teflon.
reviews.reviewText: I only cover the bottom of the fry basket with fries. I dont fill the entire thing. I typicaly only have to run the fryer for 2 rounds of 5 minutes with a stir in between. I dont like the cancer causing Teflon, so i am going to fabricate another basket to fit inside made out of stainless steel strainer mesh. This fryer is so much faster and uses so much less electricity that doing them in the oven.

I absolutely LOVE this air fryer! I don't know how I ever survived without one. It has been instrumental in weekly meal prep; cutting my prep time nearly in half without heating up my kitchen- this was key during the height of summer. Counter space in my house is limited, but I use the air fryer so frequently that it never gets put away.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and clean. Great product. Very happy.
reviews.reviewText: Great product. The more we experiment with cooking things in it the more we use and like it. We now use it almost everyday. So far usually to cook some type of side dish (french fries, onion rings, pierogies, spring rolls, etc.) but more and more often now also to cook various frozen chicken strips, fish, etc.. It’s very easy to use and clean.
So much for durability. Makes me very sad

I am an active runner and cyclist. Always looking for ways to modify my diet. I've used my air fryer quite a bit. I mainly use it for chicken. I can do 5 thighs at a time, I'll add dry rub, add panko or corn meal for an added crisp. Tastes great. I highly recommend this fryer. The timer is great, it automatically turns itself off. The kitchen does not get hot at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better to toss potatoes in a bit of oil then ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought for my mother and she loves it. Don't follow instructions for fries and stuff. Search the internet. Better to toss potatoes in a bit of oil then cook. Perfect that way really. use more oil in the bottom too. we really are not the healthy eaters but this is a lot healthier than we were eating

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a lot of Hot Air, just great quality cooking!
reviews.reviewText: We have used this a few times now with chicken and fries, and this baby rocks those. We are looking forward to trying to new things soon! I am confident of great hot aired fried foods that are stuff that we love to eat but are more sinful with the traditional deep fryer method.
I am diabetic, & live by myself, and I love this thing, hot dogs are great, sweet potato fries great, hamburger, meatloaf, chicken legs, toast, all have been awesome, great product!

I've made the best chicken wings ever in this! Also took a cheap $3 steak (slightly pounded) and came out tender, juicy, and cooked perfectly. Fries and tater tots come out crispy. Food doesn't feel "heavy" because so little oil is used. Two friends have bought one after my raving about it. Can't wait to make more food in it.

Wow didn't know what all the hype was about but quickly found out! I use a few days a week for anything from a whole chicken to reheating pizza (which makes it better than it was to begin with) Even my husband who rarely cooks has started using it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Secura fryer is well built and super easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Tried another brand that only lasted for three uses before breaking. The Secura fryer is well built and super easy to use. The best addition to my kitchen tools in a long time!!! Very happy with the quality and ease with which to use it.

I use this every day. I made bagel hotdogs yesterday. French fries, hamburger, chicken, you name it and I've prepared it. I couldn't live without this air fryer now! I make frozen individual pizza in a flash. You can cook frozen or defrosted, it's up to you, and folks it cooks in half the time!

This is a MUST have for any kitchen. You can not only really taste the food, but without the greasy heavy feeling afterward. I use mine almost everyday for something....keep trying new things with it and so far they have all turned out great. I will definitely keep an air fryer around and this one is fantastic for the price....and extremely roomy inside without taking up a lot of counter space. It's just a little bigger than my coffee maker.

The biggest basket of the lot I could find. I fry chicken for my wife and me. 4 to 5 pieces max but enough for us. I haven’t done an entire chicken but I bet it would fit. Tender on the inside and crispy outside. It does frozen fries really well too. No oil and dishwasher cleanup for basket. I love this thing!

I love my air fryer! I've been using it for the last few months with no problems. I found that it is easy to clean. (Honestly I don't even clean it every time I use it if I'm making similar things). Makes great roasted veggies, great for hot wraps/sandwiches, and so much more. I don't think I can live without it anymore!

reviews.reviewTitle: Everyone needs one of these!! This brand is affordable and reliable
reviews.reviewText: Omg! This is the best thing since sliced bread!! I brag about it to everyone! With my work I am away from home 13 hrs per day. Sometimes my grandson is there when I get home poof 10 minutes or less popcorn chicken or shrimp in a healthy way! Chicken breasts on 25 min for my husband and I! This appliance does it all! Also.. VERY easy to clean!!! Most appliances are not worth using because they are difficult to clean! NOT THIS FRYER! Simply wash to basket and wipe down the outside!

reviews.reviewTitle: The secura 4 liter is wonderful. My only comment to improve this machine would ...
reviews.reviewText: The secura 4 liter is wonderful. My only comment to improve this machine would be make the print larger and bolder on the temp control. Difficult for me to read even with glasses.

No difference between this and other popular brands.
Extremely if you do not want to use oil or make a mess in the kitchen.
Easy to use and easy to clean.
The only problem is that it did not come with the manual (although there is not much of a secret to use).

We use frozen french fries & frozen shrimp. If you don't overload it, it's cooked & crispy in 12 minutes.
Grilled cheese comes out like toasted bread so I still use a pan & butter.
My favorite is baking chocolate chip cookies. It's an excellent product.

I absolutely love cooking with this! Wasn't sure if I believe the reviews but I am pleasantly surprised by its performance. We cook ikids nuggets and french fries and they come out awesome and they're finished in less than 10 minutes. I cook with little to no oil just a little spray to make them extra crispy

reviews.reviewTitle: Timer stoped working afte4 two months.
reviews.reviewText: I liked it at first, used once per week on average but after only two months the timer stopped working and now it is useless as the return window has closed. Only large enough for 1 to 2 people.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cook almost ANYTHING in 1/2 the time...
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy, quiet, quick and even heating. We threw a frozen bisquit, frozen potato tots, and frozen sausage patties in the basket at the same time. 10 minutes later-presto! Breakfast!! No added oil! Super easy to clean. Keeps heat down in the kitchen👍🏻 Well worth the money spent!!

Very happy- especially for the price- suggestion- if you buy any air fryer get the largest you can and get a square basket- the round ones wast too much space- have made everything from fries to French toast and they do come out like fried-
One piece came damage

I bought this for my wife who knew little about air fryers and did not think she needed one. Well she loves and uses it almost daily. Not enough room to list all the different foods she has cooked. It is easy to use and easy to clean. It works like a super fast convection oven.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not happy. Need a new basket
reviews.reviewText: I received my air fryer in March of 2018. I love it, however when I was moving at the tray and basket fell out of the unit and the bass get got bent. I have the square one Insurance but it was not covered. I need to get a new basket. Please advise how I go about getting it. Thank you

reviews.reviewTitle: This is easy to use and makes delicious snacks
reviews.reviewText: This is easy to use and makes delicious snacks! I have tried this one and one with a digital interface and I liked this one much better. So easy to clean too, and cools quickly so you can do that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works like a champ with daily use for several months now.
reviews.reviewText:
Works better than leading high dollar competitor. Perfect for reheating pizza, fries, bread, anything.
Medium size makes it perfect for any space. I was sceptical at first being an off brand, but this thing out performs my expectations. No issues, no problems, no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works really great, and love that it holds a lot of ...
reviews.reviewText: Works really great, and love that it holds a lot of food for family. Pre heat it without food first, then cook your meal. And it great price.

reviews.reviewTitle: As good as I've ever eaten
reviews.reviewText:
Used it first time last night breaded chicken crispy out side, juicy inside.
As good as I've ever eaten. I can not wait to try stake tonight. ( Great product so glad I tried it, It really does what it says it will due thanks)

It works but for the money you can get much more advanced ones. The timer is just a little knob so it is hard to be accurate with it. This one was for a friend I prefer mine with a digital display. Also It is a little small just okay for 2 people.

reviews.reviewTitle: basket broke unable to dislodge to clean
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to love this product - however after only using the air fryer a handful of times the handle and basket are stuck together and i cannot clean the unit properly- I would love to give it 5 stars but cannot since its now broken-

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t over think it, it works just as good as the fancy higher brand
reviews.reviewText:
Did my research and got this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it ,We are eating healthier and the food taste amazing very satisfied
Would recommend and at great value

I don't know what I can put on here that most people don't already know, but here it goes. IT IS AMAZING! I cook and warm up my families food on there a lot more than using my oven. I makes everything nice and crunchy and the flavor sticks perfectly on whatever you season. I have one and I just got one for my sister-in-law who is head over heals with her new airfryer. I always recommend this to everyone and anyone who wants to have a healthier lifestyle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish it didn't break so soon!
reviews.reviewText: My family received this for Christmas and absolutely love it, however the handle will not hold up both pieces. Every time we remove the basket from the fryer the portion under the basket unlatches and falls off. This has caused a couple minor burns to my children.

We have used this nearly every night since we bought it and Sat and SUn for bacon. It's amazing!!! I highly suggest one, I am so excited to see my lower electric bill as I live in Key West and the AC is kicked into high gear whenever we use the regular oven.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm satisfied with my purchase and look forward to learning how ...
reviews.reviewText: This is new technology for me, so I'm learning as I go. The booklet that came with the unit was weak when it comes to recipes and variety. Thankfully, I've found a ton of recipes on the internet. Overall, I'm satisfied with my purchase and look forward to learning how to cook healthier with air fry technology.
Wonderful! We use it all the time and have never had a problem!

I bought one of these over 10 months ago and it stopped working last week. The company actually sent me a new one even though it was out of warranty. Great product ( use it constantly ) and really a stand up company,
Loved this machine!!! baked potatoes and didn,t heat up the kitchen!! tastes Great !!! I love that it shuts off when done. I liked that it had some things with it too. A-ONE in my book !!!!!!
Haven't had that long but so far it is great. Lot of features to make it easy to use and very easy to clean up afterwards. Highly recommend this little jewel. It's practical and fun to use!

reviews.reviewTitle: works great. I am learning to set the time& temp ...
reviews.reviewText: works great. I am learning to set the time& temp more precisely but everything I have cooked turned out great. it is also easy to clean which is a plus.

This is my second air fryer and hands down the best! The basket is square and made with a non stick coating. The basket is huge compared to my former round one. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was. This is a great unit! I highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple to operate; easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I am a vegetarian and I love the taste of my favorite veggies prepared in this air fryer. This is the only air fryer I've used, so I have no others to compare it to. It is quiet, simple to operate, and very easy to clean. I use it nearly every day, and I am very happy that I bought this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Versatile, I cook nearly every meal in it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this about 6 months ago now and cook b nearly everything in it. It's just me and my husband, so it's ideal for cooking two portions at a time. Everything I've cooked has come out perfect, and it doesn't heat my house up in the summer like my stove.

Love this fryer! I purchased another brand as a Christmas gift for my Mom, which quit working within the first week. It was returned and after a diligent search, I stumbled upon this one to order as a replacement for her. Due to the good reviews, size, accessories, and price, I decided to also ordered one for myself, and it has not disappointed! What a great fryer for a fraction of the cost of others!
