Gave this to my adult daughter for Christmas, she uses it constantly. She says it is so easy to use, easy to clean and food gets done so quickly. The items are crispy and cooked to perfection. She loves it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great item, cooks wonderfully all items we have tried ...
reviews.reviewText: Great item, cooks wonderfully all items we have tried especially lightly breaded chicken and veal. Skewer rack is small and limits amount of veggies and meat. Onions, and crispy onion rings are especially good in the air fryer. Easy cleaning of pan and basket.

So far it has been a very good product. I got the same one for my Sister and my Mother for Christmas. It takes a will getting used to using but I use it a lot now. Sometimes it could be a little bigger but just for me it is just the right size for most everything. I have even cooked a small pork roast in it and loved it. Steaks do well in it also.
My dad says it is just what he wanted. Works and isn't complicated. Such a great gift he actually went and bought me a gift to celebrate me making him a dad.

I have purchased 3 of these for myself, family, and a friend. It makes the best wings, fried fish, and shrimp. The French fries are delicious. Be sure to use a high heat oil or it is likely to burn/smoke (the same as an oil fryer). I also recommend a spayer that can spray extra light olive oil.
Works great but if you have a family of any size you will need 2.
After 1 year of my mom using it regularly, the coating is holding up very well. Still looks brand new.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product packaged very well with no damage and does not appear to be cheap, but a quality machine.
reviews.reviewText: This was a Christmas gift for my mom-in-law. She has yet to use it. The product was packaged very well with no damage and does not appear to be cheap, but a quality machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: This product works great as a convection oven and I have successfully air ...
reviews.reviewText: This product works great as a convection oven and I have successfully air fried pork chops and shrimp. I am having yrouble finding recipes for just air frying. It seems most people use it as a oven.

We hesitated to buy one of these but when our oven went out and we would be without it for weeks, we did! hat a surprise! Never realized how easy cooking with this product could be and the great food that comes from it! We love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is really a nice unit. Zero issues
reviews.reviewText: This is really a nice unit. Zero issues, and cheap. My wife makes a lot of stuff I didn’t know you could make in an air fryer. Would buy again without hesitation!

reviews.reviewTitle: Basket clip broke after less than a year
reviews.reviewText: I am giving a mixed review. I like my air fryer and use it frequently but I am sad to say that the basket clip broke and I haven’t had it for a year. I can still use it but I have to get a hotpad and hold the bottom of the drawer because the basket doesn’t stay anymore and it will pop right out and drop the hot drawer on me. . :-( It makes it more difficult to use.
I thought this was Bella but still working fine. Not as great as Bella thought.
This is the way to go for cooking and especially re-heating fried foods!!!!

I have had this unit for over a year and I love it! It cooks so well and it is super simple to use. No digital presets to deal with. Let's be honest, presets are so generic and it really depends on the size of say a chicken breast. The square basket is ideal and it holds a bit more. It is plenty big for a couple but you may want something bigger for a family. It's very easy to clean also. I can't rave enough about this airfyer.

I was excited to get this although took a couple of days to figure out things that were not in the instructions
Wish timer wasn’t so hard to turn
But all in all I may sell and get a Phillips
Fried French Fry's, did a great job. Recommend this product

Love this air fryer! Purchased one last holiday season for the in laws (they LOVE it, immediately opened and tried it out!), and we just bought one for our apartment. It doesn’t disappoint! Heat anything up easily and get the perfect crisp.
We did extensive research back when we bought the in-laws this air fryer and this one seemed to be the best. It’s amazing!

Use it mostly for wings and cauliflower, makes great "fried" tofu, too. I use this about every other day for something. Roasting my healthy omelette fixings is easy, then I can just pour them over the eggs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Crunchy food without the oil....for real!!
reviews.reviewText: Works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Did small pizza nicely, and good for frozen items
reviews.reviewText: Works well. My husband loves fries cooked in it, which is saying something as he is very fussy. Wish it held a little more. Did small pizza nicely, and good for frozen items.
This fryer is fantastic. Perfect size for a small family . They also have a smaller and a larger one. This is so easy to use, super easy to clean. I cannot find anything bad to say about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I knew about this air fryer years ago ...
reviews.reviewText: I wish I knew about this air fryer years ago. Whomever invented this product needs an award. This is what clean cooking and eating is about. Well worth the money!

Have yet to do well with breading items and it not falling off. On the plus side it has been great reheating items that would be soggy in a microwave. I can cook a whole pack of link sausage and hot sausage in 10 min!

Awesome little appliance. Many uses. Very nice for making fries and nuggets for the kids quickly. Quickly reheats leftovers without the microwave overdone flavor. Can stuff a lot of things in there but need to remove and shake often for even heating.

reviews.reviewTitle: I liked it so much I bought one for a friend ...
reviews.reviewText: I liked it so much I bought one for a friend who is partly paralyzed. Much simpler to clean, easy to use, throw in a couple of $0.99 air fryer cookbooks and, lo, you are a master chef!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product! I've cooked a few items in it ...
reviews.reviewText: Great product! I've cooked a few items in it and it works great, easy to clean and healthier than a grease fryer, but tastes just as good.

We have used this once and it worked very well. Love the healthy aspect. However, it came with absolutely no paperwork. No instructions, no manual, no recipes, nothing! Hence the reason for 3 stars, not 5.

Fryer works great, the 4.2 qt is big enough to handle most meals. It is easy to clean and store. It is very quiet when running. The workmanship is very good, controls are easy to use. The nonslip feet work very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought as a Mother's Day present and works great. She uses it a lot and even warms ...
reviews.reviewText: Bought as a Mother's Day present and works great. She uses it a lot and even warms up things such as tenderloins and they are just like they were originally out of the fryer.

Love this oroduct. My dagughter is a chef and told me about air fryers and this has been great so far. The only issue is the documentation isn't clear. I had my daughter who already had an air fryer and shared her exoeriences. The documentation does not lessen my satisfaction withe the fryer itself.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you have counter space it's better than a deep fat frier
reviews.reviewText: I didn't realize how big it is. If you have counter space it's better than a deep fat frier. It beats a microwave because it crisps and browns. Reheating pizza works well although it takes some practice to get the time right.
I am happy that I bought the bigger unit even if I am cooking for 2 because I can lay everything in a single layer and cook on 1 side and turn to the other side to finish and everything gets brown.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just wonderful. Ordering another for a gift
reviews.reviewText: Just wonderful. Ordering another for a gift. Made coconut shrimp and it was amazing. Juicy shrimp the best I ever had. Cooked in 10 minutes. Other dishes were also amazing.

Best investment ever!! Great for super quick meals and snacks. Corn dogs and onion rings in about 10min. Just as crispy as deep frying without the guilt. I'd take the air fryer over a microwave any day!
I love it! Makes crispy wings and thighs! Fries come out perfect! I use it a few times a week! The trick is to make sure you shake the basket every few minutes.
I don’t like cooking in the summer. The air fryer doesn’t heat up my kitchen. I’ve liked everything I’ve tried.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... chips in mine so far but I am very happy with what I have made so far
reviews.reviewText: I have only made wings and potato chips in mine so far but I am very happy with what I have made so far. Can't wait until I have more time to experiment with other recipes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great new way to fry healthy!
reviews.reviewText: Made french fries for my family right after taking it out of box. They were great. I did shake the basket and put it back in half way through like it recommends. Super easy to use. I really like it!
Secura Air Fryer has worked really well on a variety of dishes. My husband was surprised by how well it cooks salmon. I chose this brand because it has the least amount of one-stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Crispy food and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: Very good quality. Crisps things up nicely. From frying up fresh cut fries to heating up leftover battered fish, this air fryer gets the job done.
I love my new air fryer! And it was very well priced too! Go ahead and buy it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I'd bought this a long time ago!!
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATED: Less than a year later and the airfryer just quit. I went to the website and they have a different Model # listed. It started to cook, then 5 minutes later quit and hasn't worked since. I love the way it worked, but not happy that it didn't even last a year - especially since I splurged and got the more expensive product.

I didn't post a review right away, because I wanted to try out the appliance more than once. Having used it for several items, including pork loin, fries, garlic bread, steak, hamburger patties, and heating up chicken. This has become my favorite appliance!! I am glad I decided on the larger capacity. I just bought a small whole chicken and can't wait to make it in the fryer! I highly recommend the Secura 4-liter Airfryer. This came with the rack and skewers. I have used the rack, but haven't done the shish-ka-bobs, yet. I love this!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great- but only a few months
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: The air fryer does a great job and food tastes delicious. The disappointing part is that it didn't last a year. All of a sudden, kapoot - nothing. Doesn't even make a sound. I'm not wondering how to contact the company about the two year warranty.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in under six months of use!
reviews.reviewText: I would have given this air fryer a 4 star review had it not completely crapped out on us! Not only have the screws to the tray already rusted, but the entire unit stopped working in the middle of cooking dinner. I purchased this in December for a Christmas gift to my husband and we used it for the first time in February. We barely got six months out of it! What a waste.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: It took over 1.5 hours to cook fish and fries. the taste was great but I had to turn the oven on anyway to keep everything hot once it was finished cooking in the airfryer. this one was just too small

I originally bought this brand because of the size. Well, I love it. I never thought of what a great bargain I was getting.
The air fryer saves me time and the food is fabulous.
I have a happy lady.
I bought this one after going through so many and this one seems to work really well. Does the job without all the doodads and helps a inexperienced cook look good!
Works extremely well. Very large capacity. Experiment yourself on times and temperatures, but the settings list is a good starting point. Very hard to overcook things too so you've got some latitude.

reviews.reviewTitle: But after a few times of using it - I have had the best tater tots and sour kraut balls ever
reviews.reviewText: At 1st I was skeptical about this device . But after a few times of using it - I have had the best tater tots and sour kraut balls ever. I can't wait to cook other tings in this . I the basket is a real good size .
Haven’t had the chance to use it a lot yet but when I have used the air fryer my expectations are beyond what I imagined!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Why weren't these invented years ago...love my air fryer!
reviews.reviewText: I have had my Secura Hot Air Fryer for over a year & just love it. It is easy to use, easy to clean, holds more than enough food for my family & the 2 level rack makes cooking more than one thing easy too.
Works great I’ve done burgers, fries and vegetables. It has a slight new smell but getting lighter.
Nice size, quick cooking, low price - gets our tater tots done well, golden brown, a little crunchy outside, good tasty flavor, not greasy.

reviews.reviewTitle: best kitchen tool I have bought so far and healthier ...
reviews.reviewText: best kitchen tool I have bought so far and healthier because of no oil. For some foods have used spray olive oil for a more even cooking
Fryer does an amazing job on everything I have tried, meats veggies and casaroles.

Wow. So I made a "tester" meal in this which consisted of chicken nuggets and tater tots. It came out perfect. Crispy on the outside how I love it and perfect on the inside. I made the chicken nuggets and tater tots at the same time. I started off with 5 minutes on 360. Then I opened it to see the doneness, turned the nuggets, then closed it back up and let it cook for 10 minutes on 390. I also cooked breaded chicken breast chunks and home made french fries and they came out delicious. Remember, the first 3 minutes of turning this on is actually "preheating" I choose to preheat with my food already in the fryer. Just one less step for me to worry about. I can't wait to see how other foods turns out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for making fish and reheating past foods
reviews.reviewText: Great for making fish and reheating past foods. Love it. The only thing I would have to say against it would be that if you have a bigger family, it may not be suitable as even though it has a very good capacity, a family of 4 may take a bit longer to sit down at the table all at onc.
We love our new air fryer. It working and we washed it by hand.
This fryer does a great job and keeps my Okra and French Fries tasty and low calorie! Nice capacity and operation. Wonderful!
Makes the best french fries without frying! Corn dogs, tater tots, egg rolls, you name it.

Fantastic. Simple, small footprint large capacity. Very well done non stick surface, easy cleanup and FAST FAST FAST. I cooked in a toaster oven for years while a full sized oven was beyond repair, it was convection and great for many things but this is amazingly BETTER. Crisps properly, little to no oil and everything from reheats to full cooking is browned, and delicious. About as loud as a vent fan on low setting and I especially like the printed suggestions for type of food, ON the unit. You could use this with little cooking experience and no manual. My 14 yo, 22 yo, and myself use it like old-hat and I cant sing enough praises as to the convenience and more so, the PERFORMANCE and all for a bargain price compared to the competitors. NO compensation here, save money, make better faster food, and revel in the aesthetic and performance of your well made purchase! I have had many experiences with Commercial grade equipment , having been in the restaurant business AND even cooking school and this is not only up there in impressiveness, but at this cost, it is hands-down a favorite!

I’ve had this air fryer for about a month now and so far i am very happy with it. This is my first air fryer and i think this model is a good starter air fryer. Maybe i’ll Go bigger next time but overall this works just fine. Easy cleanup too. I use this everyday!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's my favorite appliance. It works great with frozen foods or ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for myself at Christmas. It's my favorite appliance. It works great with frozen foods or fresh ingredients. It cooks really quickly & the food is crispy.

Researched every single Air Fryer on Amazon, before I decided on this one. The reviews were great and it seemed a better fit so I can cook more at once to last a few days. I was especially interested in the rack for the skewers for Shish-kabobs. I used it for the first time tonight for chicken breasts and all I can say, is they turned out better than any I have ever cooked. Moist, browned, and perfect with just a little garlic salt and smoked maple seasoning sprinkled on. I can't wait to try other things. This is perfect for my new healthier lifestyle. And it's easy! Love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great cooker, takes a bit of getting used to
reviews.reviewText: I was really skeptical, even after reading all the reviews. My first use of this was for sweet potato fries, and I was disappointed. They were burnt around the edges, and tasted just like they do when they come out of my convection oven. The next attempt was "fried" chicken legs. I ran water over them to make them wet, then dropped them in a bag with gluten-free bread crumbs to evenly coat. Sprayed with a little Canola oil spray, and they came out a crunchy on the inside, and juicy on the inside, delicious! I over-crowded though, so they weren't completely done, so make sure there is space between them, not touching everywhere. I had 6 in there, but 4 should have been the limit. I've tried lamb chops which came out beautiful. I suggest buying a few Air Fryer books at the same time you purchase this, since the manual has very little information. Many recipes are available online too.

reviews.reviewTitle: No regrets, love using this to make healthier meals
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer has pleasantly surprised me. I find myself using it more often than I originally thought I would. The size is good for my household, it's nice to air fry potatoes, sweet potatoes (boniato), yellow sweet plantain, chicken nuggets and steak. I love yellow fried plantain and this provides me with a much healthier option, it cooks it well and crispy. This air fryer is practical, easy to use, light weight, easy to clean - thus far wonderful. Food cooks quicker when I preheat (as instructed), it's advisable to shake items around a couple of times or use tongs to move items around for even cooking. It takes practice, and cooking time depends on the volume placed, the less you place in the fryer, the faster it'll cook. The most notable difference for me is the appearance - it looks dry, but once you bite in you realize it's soft and juicy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth it, even if you miss the coupon code!
reviews.reviewText:
We have not been using this every single day, but not a week has gone by since purchase that we haven't used it. Not sure why we didn't jump on this air fryer bandwagon a couple years ago when we first saw one, but very happy we waited - this product has definitely been working out for us. It's not just for french fries, y'all!

Happy we chose to purchase this product with an additional coupon code. But, now that we own it, I would have paid full price.

Note: Followed the cleaning instructions prior to first use, and there was still a slight odor. So, expect that, but know that the smell doesn't last.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall pretty good, I'm just not sure about the temp
reviews.reviewText: Overall, I think this unit is pretty good. I'm just not sure about the temperature, if it's correct or not. I find myself turning it up higher to get things to cook in the time a recipe says, or that it takes and extra few minutes to cook food at the "correct" temperature. Other than that, it's a great unit, I love the accessories and yes, it's tedious to clean yet another appliance, but the desired effect is there- decent food!

I Really loved my air fryer and used it to get perfect veggies almost every day. After six months i turned dial and all that could be heard was the ticking of the timer... no heat, no fan , no perfectly cooked veggies. This is perhaps the most depressing product failure I have experienced as I am now steaming vegetables carefully on a range, trying to figure out if all air fryers are unreliable or if mine was defective or what.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... it 4 my mother she luv it nd very happy with it also da basket is a nice size ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought it 4 my mother she luv it nd very happy with it also da basket is a nice size 4 her nd xtra if need cook more in it great product ...

For the price, I am impressed. Is it perfect? No (more on that below), but pretty great.

I've reheated restaurant steak fries and cooked homemade chicken fingers so far, and I was pleased with both.

I hate throwing away food. When we eat out, I ALWAYS have leftovers; at a typical casual place, I probably bring home, on average, about a third of my food ... including lots of fries. Unfortunately, reheated fries (indeed, reheated fried things generally) are merely edible ... never good. The first thing I cooked was left-over steak fries from a national chain. The machine achieved what a standard oven and a microwave are unable to: reheated fries that are crisp outside and hot and tasty inside ... and no mush ... at all. (The fries didn't stay great for long -- I had at best 10 good minutes to enjoy them; but I suspect that's not a shortcoming of the machine, but a fact of life of the chemistry and physics of a twice-cooked potato product. I'm not holding that against the machine ... just treating it as something I should keep in mind going forward.)

After that, I dredged five chicken tenderloins in seasoned flour, immersed them in beaten egg, then pressed seasoned panko on them. Results after about 17 minutes (flipping twice): completely-cooked through; juicy; and a crunchy, browned crust. Zero complaints on the chicken.

I mentioned that it's not perfect; now about that. ...

While cooking, there was a slight plastic smell in the kitchen. That didn't affect the smell or taste of the actual food. I think this is a MINOR issue ... a non-issue to me, but some other people might be turned off.

The basket (though larger than typical of those of units at about the same price-point) does limit how much one can cook at any time. It's ideal for feeding one person or cooking a side dish for a few people (four-ish, I'd say); but preparing an entire meal for more than a couple people would take a long time (multiple batches), particularly if preparing multiple dishes. (I don't know a lot about these kinds of appliances -- don't know whether it's possible to get a bigger basket for more money; but my guess is that what makes this process feasible is a small unit ... relative to, for example, to the size of an oven.)

Finally, the timer is a bit funky. It's spring-loaded and analog, and a bit wonky to set precisely. Again, I rate that a minor issue -- particularly because (unlike a microwave, for example) an extra minute or two isn't going take the food from good to inedible (won't get too dry or chewy).

What I think is best about it: I do like fried foods (fries, cheese sticks, battered veggies, battered chicken and fish), but I HATE frying at home, because the house smells fried for three days (not to mention it's dangerous to have six inches of 400-degree oil atop the range); ... and baking / microwaving frozen pre-fried food is a sad substitute for food that's actually fried ... freshly. There's no good way (with standard kitchen appliances) to have good deep-fried food at home. THIS machine addresses that problem. That's what makes it worth having -- finally, o can have quality "fried" food at home ... safely and without smelling the oil for the three subsequent days.

More expensive units might be better, but this thing is pretty great ... within the limitations noted here ... and perfect for a nice side of fries! I'd give it 4.5 out of 5, if I could. Given the rating limitations and the price, I lean slightly-closer to 5 than 4.

On the fence about which AF to get? I went with the 1500 Watt Secura because it seemed like $229 was insane to pay for a gadget. I'm so glad I got this. I actually use it EVERY day, often 3x a day. You'll be looking around your place going, "I can air fry that!!"

This guy sits on my counter. I like leaving room around it for the hot air to blow. This is Florida and as soon as I turn on my oven, the house heats up. Since buying my Secura, I don't think I've tuned my regular oven on at all.

Cleanup is awesome.

I'm happy to cook with oil but using this, there's no need. I can add a bit towards the end to flavor and get it extra extra tasty. My favorite af thing aside from potatoes has to be air fried green beans.

Secret tips: shake EVERYTHING
Crowding the basket is for amateurs
Keep a pair of silicone coated tongs nearby to flip stuff
If you leave food inside the closed unit the basket too long it steams and doesn't stay crisp so take it out once it's done.

The only tiny downside? There's no actual power button it's just the timer knob, so you have to drag it back to zero if you are taking stuff out early, which you will because it's kind of guesswork knowing the time and temp. Also the temp knob is hard to read.

I'm in love with this thing!!!

This air fryer is very quiet compared to others. All our food is cooking perfect. The basket holds a large amount of food. It takes up a small amount of space on the counter and is shorter than those huge, oversized fryers. The sides are barely warm when in use. I'm very happy with this machine and the classy design.

reviews.reviewTitle: and they are good and healthier
reviews.reviewText:
Game Changer!!!!!

This is my first Air Fryer and I it has changed the way I cook just about everything.

Yes, it cooks fries, and they are good and healthier. But I wouldn't buy this JUST to cook fries it. You can cook pretty much ANYTHING in here and it's so EASY. I put my bread in here for toasting...turn the timer to 3-4 minutes and it comes out perfect. I like that I can go sit down in the living room and wait for the "DING" of the bell that goes off when it's ready. And if I am busy when it's ready, I can leave whatever I'm cooking in there and it won't get cold and it won't overcook......just stays warm.

So what have I cooked in there? Seems like every breakfast, lunch and dinner I use it. Toast, baked potatoes, french fries, onion rings (my batter recipe needs work as these have not turned out that great ha!). I'm a vegetarian, so I've cooked veggie burgers, veggie bacon, tofu, and all kinds of wonderful Gardein fried unchick'n, unfish, etc. in here. PIzza! You can't fit a whole pizza but you can fit a slice or a small rectangular pie.

The best way to think of it is that everything you can cook in your oven, you can cook in here much easier and faster. And the food comes out crispier. Same with the toaster--this is better. Most things that you deep fry can be cooked in there. Many things that you pan fry can be cooked in here. And it's so easy.

The Secura seems like an awesome machine. I have not tried other brands but I have to say that I have no problems at all with the Secura AND it seems very intuitive and easy to use. Also, the 4 liter capacity seems important....the more you cook with it the more you want to cook with it. For two people I think you need close to the full 4 liters. Also, the drawer and tray go in the dishwasher--that is key, although they are easy to wash out in the sink if need be as they are non stick.

I highly recommend this unit. For plus or minus a hundred bucks, it will bring you plenty of cooking joy, and save you a lot of time.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's good, but it's not a deep fryer and gives different results
reviews.reviewText:
I've only had this a couple of weeks. It's OK, but it is NOT a deep fryer and does not give the same results. It is an air fryer. You use much less oil in the cooking process. This saves calories and your arteries.
What I've cooked so far:
Home made french fries. Used about 3 tbs of oil. Turned out pretty good, not crunchy enough for my taste.
Onion Rings: Used 2 tbs oil. I followed the instructions and had rocks, barely edible.
Grilled Cheese: Spray butter. A little dry, but absolutely wonderful. Crispy on the outside, oowey-gooey on the inside.
Fish Sticks: Spray oil (a little on each side). Great, crispy on the outside moist and tender on the inside.
I wish there were more recipes available either in the booklet or on line for this particular Air Fryer. This is the biggest thing missing. I know there are a ton of recipe books, but it would have been nice to have more available from the manufacturer.
While I recommend this product, do NOT expect to have the same results as deep frying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Received a few days ago, finally had time to ...
reviews.reviewText: Received a few days ago, finally had time to unbox and wash components last night. Went to use tonight for the first time. It doesn't work. No power, no lights, no nothing other than the ticking of the timer. Worthless.

reviews.reviewTitle: I absolutely love everything I have cooked in it
reviews.reviewText: I have never had an air fryer, and I fought tooth and nail to purchase this one. I absolutely love everything I have cooked in it, but I have used it less than a month and the teflon coating on the basket already has chips in it. I had originally planned on sending it back, before I noticed the chips, because I found one for a better price that also offered accessories, such as a copper cake pan. I changed my mind and decided to keep this one, and then I noticed the chips. Otherwise, the air fryer in general is a great investment

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the most reliable brands out there!
reviews.reviewText:
I was not looking for a fryer but something to replace my Breville convection toaster that had finally failed after ten years. Not yet ready for such an expenditure so, I thought I'd try this in the meantime. It surprises me that it's doing a better job on frozen foods....clam strips, tater tots, fish fillets---it crisps better, bagels too. Thought I'd give Bibigo pot stickers a try....put a little water in the basket and sprayed them with oil a few times....Were they as good as pan fried? Damn close and no grease to be found anywhere on my counter.....love it!! Though 4.2 Qt is as small as I'd go. I am very impressed with the reliability of the Secura brand. I have two of their induction cooktops (one over 6 years old) and a Secura Electric kettle that I love and use daily. That reliability weighed heavily in my decision. I even appreciated the lack of digital controls.....less to go wrong...... Surprisingly useful product for a 1 or 2 person household.
.

Best kitchen purchase since my coffee maker. I have made wings many times and my 2 year old loves french fries. I love this thing and couldnt be happier with purchase. I have noticed that if you pre-heat it for a few minutes I get better results and it is better to not cook my wings in sauce like it suggests.

I have gotten my parents and friends to buy this brand as well and we are all 100% satisfied. My parents got 2 of them to cook 2x the food. Last visit they had 1 filled with chicken and the other with okra.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very well built, small learning curve, works as advertised
reviews.reviewText:
I like this air fryer very much! It is so easy to clean, cooks very fast and the food is so good, I put my oil fryer out in the garage. Just as a note, the metal basket does come out of the pan. The button that releases the pan from the air fryer, has another button closer to the handle that releases the basket. Well built. Had mine about a few weeks now. Will post addendums if something goes wrong, but so far extremely happy and the seller is very supportive with follow up emails letting me know if I have any problems, they want to make it right. 5 star business.
One thing I would note: BE CAREFUL when pressing the release button for the pan, and don't even think about moving this unit without the pan securely locked in place. The pan is released at a slightly downward angle, so gravity can assist it coming out, but you have to be aware that it can slide all the way out once released. Just a heads up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick & easy, extra-fat free meal prep
reviews.reviewText: Decent capacity and quick, quick, quick. We've cooked chicken nuggets, fries, hashbrown patties, dinner rolls, toast, chicken tenderloins...utility is pretty endless. Being able to cook our favorite fried foods without any added oils makes this an awesome addition to our weeknight meal preparation repertoire. We rarely use the microwave anymore. I wish there was one with an even bigger bucket, but this is adequate for our 3-person family.
This machine was awesome when I got it, but just simply stopped working after just a few months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very pleased - use almost every day!
reviews.reviewText:
I spent a lot of time and did a research before choosing an air fryer and am so glad that I got this one. I chose it in part because of it's larger capacity. I also like that it is square rather than round.
I have been using it for about a month and have not been disappointed with anything I have made.
I have made: chicken tenders, zuccinni, asparagus, home fries, fish, shrimp, turkey bacon, meatballs, stuffed mushrooms, sweet potoato fries, chicken breasts, chicken wings, corn dogs and frozen french fries.
It cleans very easily and I love that the mess is contained to a small space (instead of wiping bacon grease off my cooktop).
As some other reviewers have said, calling any of these machines "fryers" is really a misnomer. They are basically mini-convection ovens. While food will definitely come out crisp and cook quickly, it does not taste deep-fried as deep frying infused grease throughout the food and the air fryer is (thankfully) not doing that.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works well for small fried foods; my only ...
reviews.reviewText: It works well for small fried foods; my only complaint is that it is hard to figure out the timing. A more comprehensive cooking guide would be helpful.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm extremely happy with this purchase and have no excuse to not ...
reviews.reviewText: I received my air fryer on Saturday, 10/21/17 and used it on Sunday, 10/22/17. This appliance has made my life much easier. I cooked shrimp and scallops together, then I cleaned the basket and made chicken breasts. The food was flavorful and quick to make. The timing guide was accurate (except there's no guide in the manual or on the machine for seafood so I had to wing it). As instructed, I shook the basket a couple of times to ensure the shrimp and scallops cooked evenly. It was a relief to not have to turn over the chicken breasts which gave me time to concentrate on other dishes I was preparing. I'm extremely happy with this purchase and have no excuse to not eat healthier now.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is awesome! I've really only made tater tots and fish ...
reviews.reviewText:
This thing is awesome! I've really only made tater tots and fish (walleye and crappie), the fish comes out great, takes a couple of tries to get down pat. I'm doing the fish like I would when I fry with oil:
- egg and milk wash
- toss the filet into a bag of crushed saltines and shake (I'll add a teaspoon of Tony's Chachere's)
- let sit in the Secura basket for 10 minutes before cooking (seems to hold the breading on better(
- 390 for 10 minutes (could be less, could be more, I typically only put enough filets to cover the bottom of the basket, I do not overlap)

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this piece of equipment
reviews.reviewText: I really like this piece of equipment. I fixed two huge pieces of chicken bone in rolled in flour and meal and it came out really juicy and crunchy. French fries are good too. The pork chops no bone are so tender You do miss the oil in foods but they are still good. The trick is to spray a little olive oil on the food all over and it comes out really pretty and its tastes good and its healthy for you. This is a good, well made, expensive looking machine that is sturdy and easy to clean. Also, there's nothing to figure out. Just wash, put together and try with your favorite recipe. Fish is good too.

reviews.reviewTitle: this is a great addition to your kitchen
reviews.reviewText: Other than a Microwave oven, this is a great addition to your kitchen. I now enjoy fried foods with out all the grease, especially french fries. Fish and chicken do especially well cooked in this air fryer. I'm type ll diabetic and this method of cooking allows me to enjoy some foods that are normally cooked with a lot of cooking oil, that is not needed with the air fryer. For those of you who like to cook with oil, it does state that you can brush on or apply a small amount of oil if you desire. Those McDonald type hash browns come out really nice in this unit, plus it's pretty fast. The thing I always hate is the clean up after use, and let me tell you this is a breeze to clean after using it as all surfaces including the drip pan are teflon coated. Depending on what you are cooking, in a lot of cases you can just wipe the basket and drip pan with a paper towel (after it has cooled down). I usually read customer inputs about an item before deciding on purchasing, and the majority of the customers who purchased this particular brand gave it positive reviews and I also concur from my experience so far.

Pros:
-It is very easy to use and very easy to clean.
-It really puts a crispy outside on things like burritos and makes a killer grilled cheese!
-It cooks quickly, way faster than putting cheese sticks or other breaded items in the oven
-I have only scratched the surface of the potential to cook many different dishes and I’m looking forward to using this.

Con
-You can’t really overlap fries in it because I won’t cook evenly. It does brown and Chris the top of them when they are in it but you do have to turn them over. It isn’t bad for an individual portion or enough for two people but if you’re doing it for a family you would take you quite a bit longer than just putting in the oven I th you can’t really overlap fries in it because I won’t cook evenly. It does brown and Chris the top of them when they are in it but you do have to turn them over. It isn’t bad for an individual portion or enough for two people but if you’re doing it for a family it would take you quite a bit longer than just putting a sheet in the oven.

Overall this is an excellent buy IMO!

reviews.reviewTitle: A lemon, I guess nothing worked but ticking on timer
reviews.reviewText: I was so excited and ready to use this air fryer with my son a s we got it out the box and cleaned it and when we plugged it up I power light, no timer light, just ticking. I have been saving for a long time to get this and I’m very, very upset and that doesn’t work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Crispy outside, tender inside -- I am so happy I bought this!
reviews.reviewText:
Love this machine! I bought it mainly to "fry" tofu without all the oil and without having to stand over splattering hot oil pan to turn the tofu over. Works GREAT! Also, frozen french fries come out delicious and don't get hard when they cool. Chicken (fake veggie) tenders come out perfectly crispy and delicious. And it is easy to clean, no oil splattered all over the stove top. Don't know how durable it will be yet. Fingers crossed for along delicious life-span!

PS: The only thing I would complain about is that once you set the time, you can't change it and if the food is done before the timer is done, you can't stop it. You have to take the food out and let the timer run out on its own.

I purchased in November 2017 and it was my favorite purchase of anything to date. To say I’m an air fryer believer is an understatement. Then last Friday 1/10/19 it just quit. No sputter or decreased efficiency it just stopped in the middle of cooking. I thought maybe it was an issue with that outlet so I plugged in in all over the house to verify but it was truly dead. Unfortunately I can’t recommend as an appliance should last more than 13 months if it cost over $100.

The first time I used it, it gave off a very strong smell, I figured that was just it being new. The plastic on the corners where the tray slides in the housing actually melted on the first use. It's been three days since I received the unit and the smell is still in my apartment. Given how highly reviewed it was I was surprised at the issues I had.

So I was looking to replace the set it and forget it rotisserie, which my son loves. In 3 days, I’ve tried frozen nuggets, corn dogs, chicken drumsticks, and boneless pork ribs. About 10-12 minutes on snacks, 30 minutes on meat—which came out juicy and crisp. Easily fits for a family of 4. Cleanup took 3-1/2 minutes, I timed it cuz it’s important to me that’s it’s quick and easy. And best of all after having the ribs he agreed to get rid of the dreaded rotisserie!

Exceeded expectations. Essentially replaced my Breville Smart Oven for small batches of most anything. Quickly roasts vegetables for one or two, and does a great job of toasting breads. Up to four steamed buns from freezer to microwave to Secura, and in 5 minutes or less, hot, perfectly toasted buns. Since I regularly cook with external timers, I just set the temperature, turn on, and after removing food leave tray out to cool while analog timer runs down. Very easy to clean, usually with just a few swipes with a paper towel.

Only negative is the analog, spring driven, timer, relatively impractical for an air fryer, but easy to work with using a separate, digital timer.

reviews.reviewTitle: GOOD PRODUCT FOR A SINGLE PERSON OR A COUPLE.
reviews.reviewText: I love this product. The only reason l didn’t give it 5 stars was because of the very small cooking area. Even though this says ‘large capacity’ l can’t imagine using this for a family. You need to put things in that aren’t touching for the air to circulate properly. That said - for just my husband and l [or for either of us separately when home alone] it works fine for most things. I especially liked using it during the really hot weather as it does not heat up the kitchen like the gas burners or the large oven does. I also like the way it cooks and browns things like taquitos, burritos, spring rolls and things like that. Those come out looking and tasting fried rather than baked, and l love that. With some things l spritz a tiny spray of olive oil on if l want that fried look, taste and crunchy texture.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fries are not as crispy as I would like it. Chicken cooked well
reviews.reviewText: I wish there was a book with it. Very few cooking ideas came with it. Fries are not as crispy as I would like it. Chicken cooked well. Have not tried beef yet. Salmon was so far the best. Veggies were so so.

I LOVE this airfryer! My husband got it for me for our anniversary, and I have used it two or three times a week since I got it! I have read other reviews about different air fryers, and the complaints are food sticking and making it impossible to clean the basket, peeling baskets, smoke coming from the airfryer, but I have to say I have had NONE of that with this airfryer... I have never had anything stick to it, no peeling, I've never had any smoke coming from the fryer, it's a breeze to clean... I just love it!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Performance nothing close to what I expected
reviews.reviewText:
This is not at all what I expected based on the description and the great reviews. I expected a "hot air" cooker to cook with hot air. This one doesn't. Probably none of these similar devices do. It is essentially an enclosed toaster oven/broiler with a small fan mounted behind the heating element. The heating element is still directly above the food being cooked, or I should say, directly above the top layer of the food being cooked. I thought maybe I was missing a baffle or something but nope, this is the way it is. (See picture). So it chars the food on top and slightly cooks the rest.

In the second picture, you'll see our first attempt using this. Followed the directions, Fries, 700 grams (less than the maximum recommended amount of 800, above the optimum amount 500). Includes a light coating of oil to make them crispy as recommended in the direcctions. Halfway through I stirred as recommended. I wish I would have taken a picture of that - the top layer was completely charred before I stirred. After stirring the first time, I stirred every 5 minutes. The picture is actually after I had removed the worst charred fries (before I thought to take a picture). The fries did not taste good.

Then I tried just one potato, no oil, stirring every few minutes for about 12 minutes. That's the third picture.

Other than the poor cooking performance, the device seems fairly well made. But since the end result is what really matters, we are returning this tomorrow.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... for a few weeks and so far it is great. It seems best for frozen foods
reviews.reviewText: We have been using in now for a few weeks and so far it is great. It seems best for frozen foods, the corn dogs, fish sticks, and fries I put in came out great, crispy but not greasy. I fried chicken, made onion rings, and a blooming onion, and it was kind of hit and miss with these, the chicken was crispy but it really didn't have too much crust to it, the onion rings came out amazing though, the blooming onion had the same problem as the chicken, there wasn't much of a crust, but my wife liked it anyway. It has been super easy to clean and use so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Food comes out great, no mess
reviews.reviewText:
Love this item. I have used slow cookers, insta-pot, and deep fryers, and this is the best of them all. The deep fryer was good, but messy. Hard to clean when changing oil and just messy in general. Only thing I don't like about this unit is, I wish it had digital timer and temp settings. Usage of the unit is a 5 except for controls. Clean up is very easy. Don't even have to use oil on most things. If you do, just a small amount of virgin olive oil.
I cook things like chicken tenders for half the time it says to cook in oven. You may have to experiment a little on times to get results you want. So far fries, fish sticks, chicken tenders have come out great (with no oil on them )

reviews.reviewTitle: 6 months old and it stopped working
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this in December. It is now July and it stopped working. You can hear the minute button ticking but it is not heating. It blew my circuit breaker. I'm so disappointed. I really enjoyed it while it was working. Sent the seller an e-mail but did not receive a response.

reviews.reviewTitle: It isn't the most amazing thing ever, but it'll do.
reviews.reviewText:
It does one thing well, and that is take frozen foods (like fries and chicken) and make them taste like they came out of a deep fryer. However, it doesn't make fresh foods taste like they have been deep fried. I'm fine with the trade off. Also, it gives off a heated plastic aroma...you can't win them all.

The basket may be large, but you need to have the food exposed to get the crispiness you are looking for. I usually underload the tray and shake it often.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't fit much for even 2 people
reviews.reviewText: I am not happy with the space in this airfryer. 4.2 liters extra large in my mind is sizes bigger than what regular size would be, like family size, so I think it should hold a lot. We are a 2 person household, so when I buy a package of 6 whole chicken wings, remove the wing tip, and separate the flapper, it fits the 12 pieces all crammed in, and some fall off the shelf when trying to flip them, and absolutely yes, whatever you are making must be flipped. You also cannot see what's going on in there without pulling out the entire compartment and releasing all the hot air to either take a look or flip it over. Most of the air fryers I looked at last year when I purchased this were all this same style. I had no idea there were much larger capacity stainless steel multi use air fryers that could also fit a 12 inch pizza and be used to convection bake and toast as well. They are so much more attractive visually than this huge black hunk of weird shaped plastic in comparison. I finally am at the point of upgrading to that stainless steel beauty and giving this one away or donating it. Bye bye.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Invention Since the Slow Cooker!
reviews.reviewText: I debated for a long time whether an air fryer would be worth the money - but I am SO glad I took the leap! I absolutely love this thing. It is so easy to use and cleaning is a breeze. I cooked bacon for the first time using the air fryer for a 4th of July potato salad recipe and followed a suggestion I read online to put a slice of bread in the bottom to soak up the grease and avoid smoking. The pieces were crisp and tasty and adding the bread was genius (thank you, whoever posted that suggestion!). If you love kitchen gadgets and appliances that live up to the hype, this is one you should have in your kitchen.

I've never seen an air fryer before but heard a lot of great things about it. After getting it, I think it's OK (Maybe my expectations were too high?).
It's like a convection oven but a lot more air circulating in it. There's an electric heating coil and a fan above the coil that circulates the hot air around. It cooks food ok but what really bothers me is the really loud fan when it's on. Then there's the fact that the vent is in the back so you have to make sure to position the device so that nothing's blocking the back. The device is ok. Had I known, I probably would have gotten a convection toaster oven instead.

Update:
I added another star because it turned a frozen bagel to toast without defrosting in 8 mins.

Honestly speaking this fryer is great and healthy way of cooking. It does its two job very efficiently, first it does cooks the food and makes it extra tasty and crispy (we make french fries, chicken wings, indian food like samosa and pakora). Second, it does make healthy food like chicken wings it get rid of extra fat which is stored in the base of the fryer. Those stored fat at the bottom of the vessel is easy to clean as well.
I choose manual version of knob because it does last longer and is durable.
This is my experience using this product from may which is 3 months of using it.

This toy is absolutely amazing! We have completely quit using oil to fry and just use the tablespoon or so that this calls for. It seems that you can cook anything in it and it does an amazing job! Fries, chicken, chicken fried steak, fried pork chops they all come out crispy fried just as if they were in an oil fryer

reviews.reviewTitle: Secura Air Fryer is Great At a Great Price!
reviews.reviewText: I just got my Secura Air Fryer today and I unpacked it and used it right away. I made chicken nuggets/tenders and they came out fantastic! It took me longer to egg and bread the chicken then to cook the nuggets. The nuggets were done tender and delicious in 10 minutes. probably were done in 8 minutes but it said chicken breasts 13 -16 minutes but it cooks faster. I did spay nuggets before cooking with a spritz of Canola oil. Very little. Only disappointment was I thought an actual cook book came with it but only the instruction booklet with how to use the Fryer with a few pages of recipes at the end of the booklet. Easy to clean and to take apart and clean. Love it! I can't wait to make sweet potato fries and other stuff that I normally would not be able to eat on my Weight Watchers Freestyle plan, which by the way I love and have lost 30 lbs since February. I would recommend this fryer and will keep you posted on more recipes I try. BTW I am a Prime member and not paid to write this review.

reviews.reviewTitle: After reading a zillion reviews I chose this one and we love it! So far we have only used it ...
reviews.reviewText: I was considering a deep fryer for occasional and was using a standard saucepan which was always messy and wasteful, not to mention unhealthy. After reading a zillion reviews I chose this one and we love it! So far we have only used it with frozen items but are planning on trying all sorts of things in it. Very happy with this so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun and use little oil for fries.
reviews.reviewText:
It works great with shrimp chips, potato fries, sweet potato fries, burger, sausage ( pre boil ) and chicken. We are still experimenting. Nice that it does not heat up the kitchen. It is fun to cook with and it work quite fast. Easy to clean up. It does not have digital display. But the dial and temperature label is readable. The control is fine. The cooking stops every time the drawer is removed for the shake. Continue when it is put back in.
Great use it to cook for 2.

I just got my air fryer last Monday I love it. I have made chicken wings from scratch fall off the bone best wings every pork chops crispy and moist on the inside today ribeye steaks. I put on my counter and will use as my oven. I love this air fryer. I got the 4.2 and it's big enough for 2 you could cook for 4 in the fryer. But if I was buying today I would have bought 5.2 for a few dollars more. I highly recommend this for people who want to lose weight. But having said that this over cooks food better then any other devise that I have use. Secura 4.2 is very well made easy to operate. Works Great!
Happy Cooking....

I love cooking in this air fryer! It is so good that I bought a second one for my son. The attachments work perfectly fine and I did not have any issues with the appliance at all. But recently, I turned it over to better clean the inside and noticed that it is almost completely rusted. All the finish layer is coming off. This is not healthy anymore because I think that with the heat and the air all that dirt will go into the food! So sad because I love it so much! They should use material that don't get rusted for the finishing of the inside. I hope they change this part of the device for something better.

We cannot believe how much we use the Secura and how many different things it cooks superbly. I would never have believed that even a good steak would be done so beautifully. We use it for everything from bacon in the a.m. to pork chops at night. And don't even ask about the fries and onion rings. Outstanding!
We like it so much we bought one for our daughter and family in the States and sent one to our son and family in Hungary (a 220v version from Amazon.de). They report similar fine experiences. My rec is that if you don't own one, don't waste a single moment until you order. And order the Secura--some of the others are reported to have plastic odors, etc. This brand has been perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best investments ever!
reviews.reviewText: The BEST.....I got it a month ago and either myself or my daughter has used it everyday since we got it. It roast veggies like nothing I have ever seen, it cooks salmon and chicken tenders.... I made some little dough nuggets in it an they were amazing too.....I cant recommend this enough, we just love it and it does fry with no oil. I never put oil on anything I put in it and it cooks very quickly. I would have liked a digital timer better but I use my iphone has a timer. I dont think you can go wrong with this air fryer. I waited a month before I reviewed it....its definitely worth the money.

Wow, this thing is great! Perfect for on the go mom's who need to feed their kiddos quick, after school and before practice. A great alternative to fast food while still giving them the foods they love. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: The right size, not too small and not too large
reviews.reviewText: So far I've done home made french fries, spring rolls, baked potatoes, carrots, and zucchini. Results were very good. Next up will be a whole small chicken (will see how that works out). Have not tried the skewers and elevated rack yet. Had to order a 7" cake pan to try that feature out (would have been nice if it were included with the product). Size fits the mid range between the 3.2 and 5.3. Price was reasonable but wish it had the digital readouts instead of the manual. Quality appears to be excellent. Warranty exceeds that of the competition. Can't figure out why there are not more reviews/ratings for the product on youtube and the net and why it does not show up in top ten ratings. But, so far, I'm satisfied!!

It's easy to use. All you need to know is the temperature and how long to cook it. Then use the dials. If it's not done, it's easy to just close the drawer and keep cooking it. The drawer goes in and out easily and cleaning is simple too as the drawer and basket can go in the dishwasher. I haven't had any sticking problems. It comes with some recipes. Some things take longer to cook than what they say, and you do have to turn or shake certain items, which does seem a bit inconvenient, however, I think it's worth it since you are avoiding a lot of grease. I trust the Secura brand as I also a have a pressure cooker by them that has been reliable as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Forms rust on bottom plate over time!
reviews.reviewText: When I got this a few months ago, I was happy with the purchase and got quite used to air frying most foods. After using it for few months, I noted the bottom of the inner housing (refer to pics) started to form rust. Unfortunately the bottom plate is not made of rust-resistant material. I believe this unit has a flaw where there is a bit of moisture being formed when cooking. I also have the smaller digital version of Secura 3.4 Qt air fryer and it has a aluminum bottom plate and does not have the rust issue this one is having. I prefer a square basket as it can hold more items than a circular one. Due to the rust formed, I no longer use this fryer as it can have an impact on your cooking and can have a negative result on your health. As such, I do not recommend this fryer to anyone.

I looked at a lot of makes and models of air fryers before I bought this one. The long warranty plus the reviews sold me. I'm very, very happy with it and highly recommend it. I like the size, although if I had it to do over I might get an even larger one. The controls are easy to work and there's not the guess work with the digital controls like so many others. I really had no idea I'd be so thrilled with air frying or I'd have started a long time ago!

reviews.reviewTitle: After months, it's still my go-to.
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this beauty all year and continue to be very happy. I've learned to line it with tinfoil to keep cleanup much easier and this doesn't seem to detract from the frying/cooking capability at all which I found interesting. Currently obsessed with tater tots, this machine is to blame for any weight gain I may have because I've never tasted such deliciousness even in any restaurant. Moist and perfect insides, crisp crunchy outsides... shit now I need to go make another batch. Someone help me, this airfryer works too well.

If you like fried food but not the grease, the Secure Air Fried is for you. It does a fantastic job on battered chicken, eggplant, and vegetables. The French fries, homemade biscuits and pies are great. We have been trying new things every few days and have not been disappointed yet. The square tray is easier to load than the round ones.

reviews.reviewTitle: The future is better with all my possibilities of great food.
reviews.reviewText:
I have been using this Air Fryer since early April and have enjoyed the ease of cooking in it and the cleanup. I really like being able to put my food in it with not much oil, also the fact I am not heating an oven for a meal or two. I am glad that I bought the larger one, never have used one before I wasn’t sure but with what I can do with it I am glad I did. Making a couple meals for me at one time is a time saver.
I haven’t cooked a huge variety yet, just proteins and of course French fries. I bought two cookbooks so I have a ways to go in all my possibilities and it is exciting. Now I can have what I want when I want without the concern of wasting energy on the oven.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well as a healthier cooking option from our deep fry.
reviews.reviewText: Decided to give our deep fry a rest and try a healthier variation of cooking. We haven't found anything that doesn't work here that we used to deep fry, and are using this more as a 'grilling' option as well. Egg Rolls do really well in this, as do French fries and chicken nuggets. We haven't gotten too adventurous, but plan to try kabobs like shown in the picture. Havent had any need for the accessories, but they look good sitting on the counter. it doesn't heat as high (wont do more than 390) as our deep fry, so we are experimenting with timing, and you cant set it for just a minute or two if an item needs a bit more time.

Love this thing! Air fried a whole 5 pound fryer chicken. Olive oil, salt and pepper, 30mn on each side..start with breast side down in basket. Very moist with crispy skin. Whole fresh green beans and potatoes in basket with olive oil, salt pepper in 15mn.perfect!. Zucchini and yellow squash in 12 minutes, again, perfect. My husband is a happy guy. Perfect steaks every time.

I LOVE my air fryer! Its so easy to use, and I have cooked so many different things with it. I love that you can fry foods without soaking them in heavy oils. The food tastes delicious, without drying it out, and the variety of items I have cooked in it is pretty impressive. I have fried meat cutlets, salmon, beef and chicken, with minimal use of avocado oil, which keeps the meats moist, yet still gives it a fried taste. I think this appliance is an excellent buy! I highly recommend it for low-fat frying.

This works great-I love it! I've made left over pizza, perfect! Raw shrimp, tasty perfection! Frozen mozzarella sticks, don't cook them too long, they will get dry but they're great if you don't over cook. Leftover mozzarella sticks, stick them in the freezer and cook from frozen. Basically anything leftover that you don't want to get soggy in the microwave is great in here.

The plug has already melted. I bought this for my mom for Mother's day. She has used it maybe a dozen times. It overheated last time she used it and she wanted me to check it out. The plug is melted. Thank the lord it didn't start a fire. Do not reccommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Test your recipes in smaller portions.
reviews.reviewText: I like the easy way of cooking, easy clean-up; I just hope it holds up with continued use. I baked yams, potatoes; cooked frozen french fries, fried chicken, baked muffins/bread. Still experimenting. I always try new recipes in small amounts & start with lower temp than recommended; if you burn it or overcook it , it can't be fixed, but, if you undercook it, you can return it to fryer & cook it longer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything came out better than I could have done it with a traditional ...
reviews.reviewText: I am loving this air fryer. I was skeptical, but have heard so many positive things about airfrying that I decided to take a chance. I have used this a couple of times -- once to cook something simple -- a combination of fries and tater tots and the other time to make "fried" chicken and steak fries. Everything came out better than I could have done it with a traditional fryer or in the oven. Crispy outsides and juicy/moist inside and NO OIL. So easy to use. I invested in an air fryer cookbook and there are tons of things you can do with this. You can even bake a cake! Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: High quality air fryer that produces excellent crispy food
reviews.reviewText: For a long time I have heard of "air fryers" but wasn't sold on them yet. Then I read a review of the Secura 4 Liter air fryer and I had to give it a shot. The size of the unit, easy clean-up, and quick cooking times sold me on this unit. I really enjoy cooking with this unit and so does my wife. In the first month we have used it just about everyday. Recipes were easy to find on line and of course, my wife and I have added our own spices creations to cook. Our 9 and 11 year old children even help us cook with the fryer. It is safe to use in the kitchen with children helping prepare and cook with the fryer and the non-stick pan is incredible which makes cleaning the unit very easy.

I've had this air fryer for almost a year and I love it! We use it daily we've made chicken, fish, burgers, and steak in it. I cleans up like a dream! I love to roast veggies in it ! it also makes the best grilled cheese sandwiches ever. The 4 quart is the perfect size for a family of three, so far the only thing I've cooked in batches is french fries and zucchini. Everything else fits in just fine. I think the square basket is the best.

I purchased the hot air fryer over a year ago. Most important is the square basket which fits more items such as 4 chicken thighs. Things it does well: steak, corn on the cob, croutons, and seFood including clam strips.. Some are prepared for frying and others prepared by my dipping the item in a wash and bread crumbs. When cooking for two the opportunities are endless. I recommend hot air frying to everyone.

When I got this I wasn’t sure I would use it much, but I have used it A LOT!. Throwing veggies in to roast in 10 to 15 minutes, or the famous French fries sans deep frier is great. I’ve made chicken breasts, pork chops and burgers and all came out nice. I read that with all the heat, it was better to get a dial unit than a digital since the digital didn’t tolerate the heat as well and using this couldn’t be easier. You dial in the time on the top knob and the temp on the bottom an that’s it. It’s a nice size and pretty easy to clean.

I was hesitant about buying an air fryer as I am not a big fried food fan and was afraid I wouldn't use it enough to justify the cost and space on my counter. Boy was I wrong. I seem to use it at least five times a week and sometimes twice a day. It is well built and easy to clean and so far I have had no issues with the coating which seems to plague other air fryers. I have had it approx. 2 months and couldn't be happier.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great fryer, life line was under two years
reviews.reviewText:
I really did enjoy the product. I purchased it summer 2017 and it almost lasted the 2 years but unfortunately the fan just stopped working which was super upsetting.

Cleaning is decent. It states you can bake a cake in here but I haven't figured out exactly how. On the other hand, I have made things like chicken, roasted potatoes, cinnamon buns, veggies, pork chops, burgers, and a few other things.

I really wish it would've lasted a full two years.

reviews.reviewTitle: All the great crunch without all the guilt!
reviews.reviewText: I've had my Secura air fryer now for over a month and it is amazing. I am definitely a kitchen gadget junky and this has quickly become my favorite item. So far I have cook mozzarella sticks, chicken tenders and french fries. All I can say is wow. Living in the south this thing is amazing because it gives me the feel of eating fried food without having my kitchen smell like a grease trap or heating my whole house up because I would bake these items. It's extremely easy to clean with the basket and basket shield being machine washable. I highly suggest picking this kitchen gadet up. It will change your eating habits for the better!

Loved the air fryer. Easy to use and really easy to clean. We basically just used it for fries. Nothing fancy.
Unfortunately it just stopped... died on us. Maybe we made to many fries??? Will not be buying this again. Should last at least a year. Disappointing..

reviews.reviewTitle: Its the ultimate accessory for my kitchen
reviews.reviewText:
I felt like a kid waiting for Santa for the arrival of my air fryer. I had read all the reviews on t-fal and phillips and chose the Secura. As soon as it arrived I ripped open the box washed the basket sliced some baby potatoes, lightly coated them with olive oil and popped them in the air fryer.
10 minutes later without flipping them I took them out and presented them to my wife for "THE TASTE." I do all the cooking and my wife can be a harsh critic of anything new. ( I had just bought and Instant Pot which she loves). So the results of the potatoes which I lightly coated with olive oil ( a teaspoon) and a little salt....Home Run!!! You won't be disappointed. So I really put the Secura to the test with another vegetable....Asparagus..
My wife rarely eats asparagus and I've tried boiling, and broiling...In the secure she ate everything..Buy this unit

I was skeptical about buying an air fryer, the hype surrounding them seemed unbelievable, but I was inspired with the thought of cooking fun foods like french fries in a healthier way. Since my fryer just came a couple of days ago and I don't have any potatoes and since I had some left over beef and cabbage I decided to try piroshki. I was so pleased with the results I had to take a picture. I followed a regular recipe and cooked the piroshki (4 at a time) on 10 minutes each side at 230 and finished off 5 or 6 minutes at 360. They came out great tender on the inside and crispy on the outside. The best parts are not having to heat my oven or make a mess frying and also that I could easily change the temperature from a low heat for baking to a high heat for browning. I really do think this is a great product and am glad I took the plunge and bought it.

This is the most fabulous cooker ever. My husband and I borh have high cholesterol but we love fried foods. Have used for chicken, fries and burgers and have had it just a short time. Chicken was so juicy, browned and crunchy. Baffled at how it works. It just does it with a spray of Pam. Fries and burgers were great! It will be used a lot. A lot less mess and faster too.

I've owned this appliance for 3 months now and LOVE it. We use it at least 3x/week. It's great for heating things up quickly and without the rubbery or soggy texture you get with some foods in a microwave. We have also had excellent results making chicken wings, homemade fries, chicken breasts and fish filets. It does a great job heating up frozen foods like fries and breaded items as well as for reheating pizza and other leftovers quickly. It is easy to clean and very simple to use. I would buy it again and highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: but this thing is awesome. So far I've made out of this world ...
reviews.reviewText: I came into the whole air fryer a bit skeptical, but this thing is awesome. So far I've made out of this world wings, chicken and steak skewers, fried eggs & omelets that were crunchy outside and incredibly fluffy in, raw potatoes fries with just a hint of olive oil that were incredibly crisp and delicious. I think the only thing I've not cooked to perfection would be egg rolls, but they just cracked a little. Check out recipes online, there are so many options like cooking a steak on the pan and your appetizers on the rack and they all come out crisp and delicious without all the added fatty oils quick and easy. The cooking surfaces and cleanup is pretty much just washing with a little soap and rinsing off, so far no scrubbing at all! I would recommend seasoning your basket and rack with just a dab of peanut oil before putting it up so it stays super easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the one to buy!
reviews.reviewText: Great air fryer, have been young this in place of regular frying. quick results, extra large basket, easy to clean. A non-stick coating that is actually non-stick :) . Very easy to use. Makes great Fries both potato and sweet potato, croquets, spring rolls, hash brown patties, baked vegetables, mounds or roasted brussels sprouts... it goes on with what you can cook in an air fryer with little to no oil. As you can see I love this machine. Has a good warranty but I have had no need to access it.

I received my fryer today and after reading instructions I decide to use it. I did fried chicken and the taste was excellent. The cleaning was not so easy because I didn't noticed the instruction how to get the basket out. After finally realizing how to do it every thing went smooth. I wish there was little bit more information about this specific issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: I kept adding cooking time like the recipe book said
reviews.reviewText: Tired the chicken fingers first. The buttermilk battered chicken fingers never browned. I kept adding cooking time like the recipe book said, but all I ended up with was pale white dried batter with large black spots on it. The chicken meat got dried out after soooo much cooking. Not impressed.

reviews.reviewTitle: It really works for your body!
reviews.reviewText:
Been using this for months. I cook almost everything in it. I never liked fried wings, but it this the flavor was amazing, crispy and no fat or oil to deal with.

I started a diet after I purchased, so I only tried the wings once, but I cooked EVERYTHING in it. And this air fryer helped me lose 30 pounds.

I highly recommend it, and after you use it, just toss it in the disher.

This is great for summer time. It doesn't heat the kitchen up like the oven, it's much more convenient and it saves time. The only negative thing I have found is if you pull the drawer out too far it will fall out in the floor. I found out the hard way when I pulled it out and turned around only to hear the whole drawer slide out onto the counter and into the floor. It broke a little trim piece off the handle. I have no other complaints and love the way it works. I'm glad I bought an air fryer.

Makes nice crispy French Fries and Tater Tots. I have also cooked excellent chicken thighs and breasts. A little soy sauce and garlic powder on them, and turning them half-way through cooking are tasty and well browned. I have also done steaks and pork chops. Much faster than if done on a stove. No extra grease for the potatoes. When cooking meats, the fat stays in the bottom of the tray. Easy to clean!

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! This is the one you want!
reviews.reviewText: I love to cook and this is the one you want! With much success, I’ve cooked Sahlen hot dogs with skins, beef steaks, cubed fresh-cut potatoes, Brussels sprouts, fresh chicken “fingers”, fresh chicken wings, frozen breaded onion rings, successfully! Husband had no idea!! Cones with cookbook. Very easy to clean!! Baskets are water submerssible, non-stick. Endless possibilities! Find cooking tips online and on a Pinterest!! Cooking is a breeze! Grease drips out of meats, away from food.

When the fryer got in in a HUMONGOUS box, my husband said "I bet this ends up in the garage in less than a week." Well, we have been using it every day and have vegetables-only dinners because they taste so amazing cooked here. Durability is yet to be seen and that is a concern given it was raised by many reviewers but the product itself is a life-saver for eating healthier, yummier and for those busy mornings preparing lunchboxes.

This has turned out to be a very nice item for a widow to cook salmon plank pieces in 12 minutes or so. Am not a fries person but make chicken nuggets and they are fantastic. Soak the pieces for 30 minutes, in a zip bag with dill pickle juice or hot pepper juice if you like them spicy. They coat as usual to 'fry' them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very easy to use and clean!
reviews.reviewText: I love this. I have not cooked on my stove in over 2 weeks. The only advice I can give is cook times, I set the recommended cook times however, I tend to find that it takes a few minutes less for most of my meals. I just keep my meat thermometer handy. Very easy to use and clean!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is great. Some of the best non-fried chicken breasts I've ...
reviews.reviewText: I did not want another 'gadget' that would do something different only to be shelved away after the newness wore off, or cleanup made it difficult to use to the point of abandonment. The prior reviews made me pull the trigger and order this. I was looking for healthier alternative to frying. This thing is great. Some of the best non-fried chicken breasts I've done that were not grilled perfectly. I used cajun spices on the first couple of chicken breasts I cooked, one with O'Brien potatoes (cubed, and added garden peppers half way through when I turned the chicken and shook the potatoes. Chicken had great appearance, juicy but done inside. Potatoes were excellent too. It was a breeze to clean up, just dish soap, bit of brushing, and rinse. Both the drawer/grill/grid part that sits inside the drain drawer, both cleaned easily. Dry with towel and use damp towel on inside of unit to keep it clean, and you're done. Has a big footprint and tall to the point it may test low hung cabinets that hang over the counter area. I just unplug my unit and store it in another adjacent room. I think it would do three large chicken breasts at a time, but I've only done two at a time so far. But one breast and a batch of potatoes made a perfect, one-person meal. Could easily have fed two, as the breast was 10 oz or more. Double batch of potatoes. If I was regularly cooking for two/three or more, I might get a larger unit. Set it for 360 degrees, 15 minutes, done. Great gear I plan to use often. Edit: I've now cooked a pound of Salmon, after quartering the fresh Salmon. Misted with olive oil, seasoned. 12 minutes at 350 degree setting. Perfect. I usually smoke my Salmon, which takes hours with seasoning, and low cooking temperatures. I also froze another pound of Salmon at the same time, then pan thawed it in water, but it was more 'fishy' than the first pound cooked when fresh. Also cooked 3 large, skinless chicken breasts in it, 20 minutes, done. Quite good, still impressed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Once you see how well it cooks you need several!
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to use & clean. Cooks food incredibly well - browns & crisps as would in a conventional oven Also cooks meat great - keeping it incredibly moist. Only wish I would’ve bought a larger one. Once you start using it you want to cook everything in there. Maybe a double air fryer? Would also be nice if it came with a recipe book - great purchase!

I made three things within the first hour of owning this! It is perfect!
Very easy to use! The basket is big enough for several servings. It is fast and easy to clean up!

reviews.reviewTitle: Really GREAT cooks very fast saves on electric cooks right to ...
reviews.reviewText: Really GREAT cooks very fast saves on electric cooks right to the temp settings and so easy to clean Do not know how ever made out without it. Thought microwave was good but there is no comparison to this and i never have oil to get rid of and food just taste so GTEAT you can't even tell it was not cooked in oven. Saves from kitchen from getting hot in summer time also
